In Greek mythology , Catreus ( Katreus , English translation : `` down - flowing '' ) was a king of Crete and a son of Minos and Pasiphaë .
Princess Margarita of Greece and Denmark ( Greek : Πριγκίπισσα Μαργαρίτα της Ελλάδας και Δανίας ; 18 April 1905 -- 24 April 1981 ) was the eldest child and daughter of Prince Andrew of Greece and Denmark and Princess Alice of Battenberg .
The Sula River ( Ukrainian : Сула́ ; Russian : Су́ла ) is a left tributary of the Dnieper River with a total length of 365 km and a drainage basin of 19,600 km² .
The Arize is a river of France , a right affluent of the Garonne .
The Neuse River is a river rising in the Piedmont of North Carolina and emptying into Pamlico Sound below New Bern .
The river Ternoise ( Dutch : Ternaas ) is one of the small chalk streams that flow from the plateau of the southern Boulonnais and Picardy , via the Canche , into the English Channel .
South Morava or in the past Bulgarian Morava ( Serbian and Macedonian : Јужна Морава , Serbian Latin : Južna Morava ; pronounced ( jûːʒnaː mɔ̝̌rav̞a ) ; Bulgarian : Българска Морава , Balgarska Morava ) is a river in southern Serbia which represents the shorter headwater of Great Morava .
Most commonly , the Paroo River terminates on the floodplain south of Wanaaring ; and only reaches the Darling River in the wettest of years , otherwise spilling into the Paroo River Wetlands .
The Tooloom Creek , a perennial stream of the Clarence River catchment , is located in the Northern Rivers region in the state of New South Wales , Australia .
Archer Creek , a northern tributary of the Parramatta River , is a creek west of Sydney Harbour , located in Sydney , New South Wales , Australia .
The Chesapeake Bay ( /ˈtʃɛsəpiːk/ CHESS - ə - peek ) is an estuary lying inland from the Atlantic Ocean , and surrounded by the North American mainland to the West , and the Delmarva Peninsula to the east .
The Ndjili River is a river that flows from the south through the capital city of Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of the Congo , where it joins the Congo River .
The Lehigh River , a tributary of the Delaware River , is a 109-mile - long ( 175 km ) river located in eastern Pennsylvania , in the United States .
The Landwehr Canal , or Landwehrkanal in German , is a 10.7-kilometre ( 6.6 mi ) long canal parallel to the Spree river in Berlin , Germany , built between 1845 and 1850 according to plans by Peter Joseph Lenné .
Hobølelva is a river rising in Sværsvann in Oslo , until joining Lake Vansjø in Østfold .
Wood Creek in Central New York State flows westward from Rome , New York to Oneida Lake .
The Geary River rises in the Otway Ranges in southwest Victoria , near Parkers Spur and flows generally east by south through the Port Campbell National Park before reaching its river mouth and emptying into Bass Strait , northeast of Cape Otway and south of the town of Marengo .
The North Para River originates in the Barossa Ranges near Eden Valley and follows a meandering path through the Barossa Valley , firstly north to the east of Angaston , then arcs around to the southwest to pass through the towns of Nuriootpa and Tanunda , before merging with the South Para River in Gawler forming the Gawler River .
The Sainte - Anne - de - Bellevue Canal is a canal and set of locks linking Lake Saint - Louis and Lake of Two Mountains at Sainte - Anne - de - Bellevue , the very westernmost point of Montreal Island , Quebec , Canada .
It originates northeast of the Mondsee and joins the Ager River after 51 km at Vöcklabruck .
The river rises in the hills to the western side of the Ophthalmia Range and flows in a southerly direction before veering east near Kundering Range and past the Angelo River Mine and Angelo River prospect , a Uranium deposit then finally discharging into the Ashburton River of which it is a tributary .
The Riet River is a westward - flowing tributary of the Vaal River in central South Africa .
The Motloutse River is a river in Botswana , a tributary of the Limpopo River .
The Heimersheimer Bach is a roughly ten - kilometre - long stream and tributary of the Selz in the German region of Rhenish Hesse .
The Tárcoles River , also called the Grande de Tárcoles River or the Río Grande de Tarcoles , in Costa Rica originates on the southern slopes of the Cordillera Central volcanic range and flows in a south - westerly direction to the Gulf of Nicoya .
The Volta River is a river , primarily flowing in Ghana , that drains into the Atlantic Ocean at the Gulf of Guinea .
The Wonnangatta River is a perennial river of the Mitchell River catchment , located in the Alpine and East Gippsland regions of the Australian state of Victoria .
The Enz is a river flowing north from the Black Forest to the Neckar in Baden - Württemberg .
The Serorome River is a river in the Central District of Botswana , a tributary of the Limpopo River .
The Zhelcha River ( Russian : Желча ) is a river in Strugo - Krasnensky and Gdovsky Districts in Pskov Oblast , Russia , a tributary of Lake Peipus .
Toongabbie Creek , an urban watercourse that is part of the Parramatta River catchment , is located in Greater Western Sydney , New South Wales , Australia .
The Patapédia River ( French : Rivière Patapédia ) is a tributary of the Restigouche River in northwest New Brunswick and southeast Quebec , Canada .
Algés River flows into the Tagus River in Algés Parish , Portugal .
The River Barle runs from the Chains on northern Exmoor , in Somerset , England to join the River Exe at Exebridge , Devon .
At Arles , near its mouth on the Mediterranean Sea , the river divides into two branches , known as the Great Rhône ( French : Le Grand Rhône ) and the Little Rhône ( Le Petit Rhône ) .
Specifically the Semowane River discharges to Sua Pan .
Gudenåen flows a total of 176 kilometres ( 109 mi ) from Tinnet Krat in Vejle Municipality , between Nørre Snede and Tørring - Uldum , to Randers Fjord in Randers , on a northward course which takes it through the central parts of Jutland .
Bystry Tanyp River , or Tanyp River ( Russian : Быстрый Танып ) , is a river in Bashkortostan and Perm Krai in Russia , a right tributary of the Belaya River .
The Winnipeg River is a Canadian river which flows from Lake of the Woods in the province of Ontario to Lake Winnipeg in Manitoba .
The Crawfish River is a tributary of the Rock River , 80 miles ( 130 km ) long , in south - central Wisconsin in the United States .
Elgi River ( Russian : Эльги ) is a river in Yakutia in Russia , a left tributary of the Indigirka River .
The Murrindal River rises below Butchers Ridge , and flows generally south , joined by one minor tributary , before reaching its confluence with the Buchan River west of Lucas Point in the Shire of East Gippsland .
Vaupés River ( Uaupés River ) is a tributary of the Rio Negro in South America .
The Hushe River is a tributary river to the Shyok River which itself is tributary to the Indus River .
The Agwei River or the River Agwei , also spelled Agvey , is a tributary of the Pibor River that flows through eastern South Sudan and western Ethiopia .
The Ouelle River flows through the towns of Saint - Pacôme and Rivière - Ouelle in Québec and enters the Saint Lawrence River to the west of Rivière - Ouelle .
The Nansen International Office for Refugees ( French : Office International Nansen pour les Réfugiés ) was an organization established in 1930 by the League of Nations and named after Fridtjof Nansen , soon after his death , which was internationally in charge of refugees from war areas between 1930 and 1939 .
The Caravaggisti ( or the `` Caravagesques '' ) were stylistic followers of the 16th - century Italian Baroque painter Caravaggio .
Mount Baden - Powell ( /ˈbeɪdən ˈpoʊ.əl/ ) is a peak in the San Gabriel Mountains of California named for the founder of the World Scouting Movement , Robert Baden - Powell , 1st Baron Baden - Powell .
Parelli Natural Horsemanship ( also known as Parelli or PNH ) is a program of natural horsemanship , created in 1981 by Pat Parelli .
Sachertorte ( German pronunciation : ( ˈzaxɐˌtɔʁtə ) ) is a specific type of chocolate cake , or torte , invented by Austrian Franz Sacher in 1832 for Prince Wenzel von Metternich in Vienna , Austria .
The Sołtan argument is an astrophysical theory outlined in 1982 by Polish astronomer Andrzej Sołtan .
Palmi Cathedral or the Church of Saint Nicholas ( Italian : Concattedrale di Palmi , Chiesa di San Nicola ) is the principal church of Palmi in Italy , and co - cathedral of the diocese of Oppido Mamertina - Palmi .
The Helmholtz free energy was developed by Hermann von Helmholtz , a German physicist , and is usually denoted by the letter A ( from the German `` Arbeit '' or work ) , or the letter F .
Thorildsplan is a small park in Kristineberg in Stockholm , named in 1925 after the writer Thomas Thorild ( 1759 - -1808 ) .
The Ottoman Empire ( /ˈɒtəmən/ ; Ottoman Turkish : دَوْلَتِ عَلِيّهٔ عُثمَانِیّه‎ Devlet - i Aliyye - i Osmâniyye , Modern Turkish : Osmanlı İmparatorluğu or Osmanlı Devleti ) , also known as the Turkish Empire , Ottoman Turkey or Turkey , was an empire founded in 1299 by Oghuz Turks under Osman I in northwestern Anatolia .
De Gua 's theorem is a three - dimensional analog of the Pythagorean theorem and named for Jean Paul de Gua de Malves .
Hermite 's problem is an open problem in mathematics posed by Charles Hermite in 1848 .
In quantum mechanics and quantum field theory , a Schrödinger field , named after Erwin Schrödinger , is a quantum field which obeys the Schrödinger equation .
Znám 's problem is named after the Slovak mathematician Štefan Znám , who suggested it in 1972 , although other mathematicians had considered similar problems around the same time .
The Dvorak technique ( developed between 1969 and 1984 by Vernon Dvorak ) is a widely used system to estimate tropical cyclone intensity ( which includes tropical depression , tropical storm , and hurricane / typhoon / intense tropical cyclone intensities ) based solely on visible and infrared satellite images .
The Nyquist frequency , named after electronic engineer Harry Nyquist , is half of the sampling rate of a discrete signal processing system .
The Order of Suvorov ( Russian Орден Суворова ) is a military decoration of the Russian Federation named in honor of Russian Field Marshal Count Alexander Suvorov ( 1729 - -1800 ) .

Prinz Eugen , der edle Ritter ( prince Eugene , the noble knight ) is a German folksong about the victory of Prince Eugene of Savoy in 1717 during the Austro - Turkish War of 1716 - -1718 .
In mathematics , Jordan 's inequality , named after Camille Jordan , states that \frac(2)(\pi)x\leq \sin(x ) \leq x\text ( for ) x \in \left(0,\frac(\pi)(2)\right ) .
The Brandeis Medal is awarded to individuals whose lives reflect United States Supreme Court Justice Louis Brandeis ' commitment to the ideals of individual liberty , concern for the disadvantaged and public service .
Christiania , also known as Freetown Christiania ( Danish : Fristaden Christiania ) is a self - proclaimed autonomous neighborhood of about 850 residents , covering 34 hectares ( 84 acres ) in the borough of Christianshavn in the Danish capital Copenhagen .
Hilbert 's twenty - third problem is the last of Hilbert problems set out in a celebrated list compiled in 1900 by David Hilbert .
Mao Zedong Thought ( simplified Chinese : 毛泽东思想 ; traditional Chinese : 毛澤東思想 ; pinyin : Máo Zédōng Sīxiǎng ) , or Maoism , is a political theory derived from the teachings of the Chinese political leader Mao Zedong ( 1893 - -1976 ) .
The LOKI algorithms were named for Loki , the god of mischief in Norse mythology .
The Karl Schwarzschild Observatory ( German : Karl - Schwarzschild - Observatorium ) is an astronomical observatory originally founded in 1960 as an affiliated institute of the former Deutsche Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Berlin and named in honour of the astronomer and physicist Karl Schwarzschild .
The P-700 Granit ( Russian : П-700 `` Гранит '' ; English : granite ) is a Soviet and Russian naval anti - ship cruise missile .
The Musée Zadkine is a museum dedicated to the work of sculptor Ossip Zadkine ( 1890 - -1967 ) .
In differential geometry , a Sasakian manifold ( named after Shigeo Sasaki ) is a contact manifold ( M,\theta ) equipped with a special kind of Riemannian metric g , called a Sasakian metric .
Charles Darwin 's frog , Ingerana charlesdarwini , is a species of frog in the Ranidae family .
The Schiff test is an early organic chemistry name reaction developed by Hugo Schiff , and is a relatively general chemical test for detection of many organic aldehydes that has also found use in the staining of biological tissues .
Berlin Tegel Airport ( German : Flughafen Tegel `` Otto Lilienthal '' ) ( IATA : TXL , ICAO : EDDT ) is the main international airport of Berlin , the federal capital of Germany , ahead of the smaller Berlin Schönefeld Airport .
The Panetta Review was a secret internal review conducted by Leon Panetta , then the Director of the United States Central Intelligence Agency , of the CIA 's torture of detainees during the administration of George W. Bush .
Aberri Eguna ( `` Fatherland Day '' ) is a holiday coinciding with Easter Sunday which has its roots in the Basque nationalist movement .
In number theory , the Elkies trinomial curves are certain hyperelliptic curves constructed by Noam Elkies which have the property that rational points on them correspond to trinomial polynomials giving an extension of Q with particular Galois groups .
The Egon Erwin Kisch Prize ( German : Egon - Erwin - Kisch - Preis ) was a literary prize awarded in Germany .
Cyrenaica ( /saɪrɨˈneɪ.ɨkə/ SY - rə - NAY - ə - kə ; Ancient Greek : Κυρηναϊκή Kyrēnaïkḗ , after the city of Cyrene ; Arabic : برقة‎ Barqah ; ) is the eastern coastal region of Libya .
The Heinrich Böll Foundation ( hbf ; German : Heinrich - Böll - Stiftung e . V. , hbs ) is a German , legally independent political foundation .
The Hadley cell , named after George Hadley , is a tropical atmospheric circulation which features rising motion near the equator , poleward flow 10 - -15 kilometers above the surface , descending motion in the subtropics , and equatorward flow near the surface .
International Francophonie Day ( French : Journée internationale de la francophonie ) is observed within the International Organization of La Francophonie 's 77 member states every March 20 to celebrate the French language and Francophone culture .
MPQ ( Mo'PaQ , short for Mike O'Brien Pack , named after its creator ) , is an archiving file format used in several of Blizzard Entertainment 's games .
Occam 's razor ( also written as Ockham 's razor , and lex parsimoniae in Latin , which means law of parsimony ) is a problem - solving principle attributed to William of Ockham ( c. 1287 - -1347 ) , who was an English Franciscan friar and scholastic philosopher and theologian .
Established by the Mo Ibrahim Foundation in 2007 , the Ibrahim Prize celebrates excellence in African leadership .
Linnaeus University was established in 2010 by a merger of former Växjö University and Kalmar University ( Högskolan i Kalmar ) , and has been named in honour of botanist Carl Linnaeus .

The Kill Point is an American television series that follows a group of U.S. Marines recently returned from serving in Iraq as they come together to pull off a major bank heist of a Three Rivers Bank branch in Pittsburgh .
City War is a 1988 Hong Kong crime action film directed by Suen Chung and starring Chow Yun - fat and Ti Lung in their third collaboration after A Better Tomorrow 1 and 2 .
Blood on the Forge is a migration novel by the African - American writer William Attaway set in the steel valley of Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania during the 1919 , a time when vast numbers of Black Americans moved northward .
A Social Celebrity is a 1926 American silent comedy - drama film directed by Malcolm St. Clair and starred Louise Brooks as a small town manicurist who goes to New York City with her boyfriend ( Adolphe Menjou ) , a barber who poses as a French count .
Richard Inwards ( 22 April 1840 , Houghton Regis -- 30 September 1937 ) was a mining engineer , an astronomer and a meteorologist .
Jana Lindsey ( born September 18 , 1984 , Rapid City , South Dakota , United States ) is an American freestyle skier who has competed since 1999 .
Herman L. Taylor , Jr. is an American politician who served as a member of the Maryland House of Delegates from 2003 - 2011 in Maryland 's 14th Legislative District .
Eugene A. Besson was a Massachusetts pharmacist and politician who served in both branches of the Massachusetts legislature , and as the 27th Mayor of Lynn , Massachusetts .
Steponas Kairys ( pronunciation ; December 20 , 1878 Old Style / January 3 , 1879 New Style in Užnevėžiai , near Ukmergė -- December 16 , 1964 in Brooklyn ) was a Lithuanian engineer , nationalist , and social democrat .
Tom Ashbrook is an American journalist and radio broadcaster .
Hanna Mergies is a Polish amateur snooker player .
Lewis Beach ( March 30 , 1835 -- August 10 , 1886 ) was an American politician and a U.S. Representative from New York representing two different congressional districts , the fourteenth and the fifteenth .
Yitzhak Pundak , born Yitzhak Fundik ( Hebrew : יצחק פונדק‎ ; born June 13 , 1913 ) , is a former Israeli general , diplomat and politician .
Hakan Peker ( born February 5 , 1961 ; Istanbul ) is a Turkish dancer , songwriter , singer , and music composer .
Richard Kovacs ( May 5 , 1884 -- December 29 , 1950 ) was a physician that pioneered diathermy as a therapy .
Frank M. Robinson ( August 9 , 1926 -- June 30 , 2014 ) was an American science fiction and techno - thriller writer .
Magnus Swartling ( born February 19 , 1970 in Uppsala ) is a Swedish curler and world champion .

George R. Roberts ( born 1944 ) is an American financier and was one of the three original partners of Kohlberg Kravis Roberts ( KKR ) , which he co - founded alongside Jerome Kohlberg and first cousin Henry Kravis in 1976 .
Clay Boland was a dentist and composer of popular songs .
Rebecca Storm is a British singer and musical theatre actress , born Eliazabeth Hewlett , in Shipley in West Yorkshire , England .
Justin McDonald is a British actor of film , television and theatre .
Emil Weyr ( July 1 , 1848 -- January 25 , 1894 ) was an Austrian mathematician , known for his numerous publications on geometry .
Vidal of Tolosa ( Hebrew : וידאל די טולושא ) was a Spanish rabbi and scholar of the latter half of the fourteenth century .
Paul Louis Mercanton ( 1876 - -1963 ) was a Swiss meteorologist , glaciologist and Arctic explorer .
Tommy Asher Danvers , better known by his stage name TommyD , is a producer , songwriter , arranger , DJ , and multi - instrumentalist .
Enoch McLain Toler , known as E. M. Toler ( October 29 , 1874 -- October 21 , 1954 ) , was a physician from Clinton , Louisiana , who was from 1944 until his death a decade later a member of the Louisiana State Senate from East and West Feliciana Parish .
Dan Leibovitz ( born July 30 , 1973 ) is a former American basketball coach .
Robert Piotrowski ( born 1963 ) is an architect .
Ed Greene is an American drummer and session musician .
Edward Mylius was a journalist jailed in 1911 for criminal libel for publishing a report that King George V of the United Kingdom was a bigamist .
Div Sultan Rumlu ( Persian : دیو سلطان روملو‎‎ ) was a Turkoman military commander andand politician from the Rumlu clan , one of the seven chief Qizilbash tribes which provided crack troops for Safavid guard .

Gilles Floro ( born in Guadeloupe April 18 , 1964 -- died in Gourbeyre , Guadeloupe June 22 , 1999 ) , was a popular French Antillean zouk love singer .

W. H. Taylor was an English cricketer who played 18 first - class matches for Somerset in 1910 and 1911 .
Jedd P. Ladd ( September 28 , 1828 -- December 27 , 1894 ) was a Vermont politician and attorney who served as state Auditor of Accounts .
Cristian Popescu Piedone ( born February 15 , 1963 ) is a Romanian politician who has served as mayor of Bucharest 's Sector 4 from 2008 until the November 4 , 2015 , when he resigned following the Colectiv nightclub fire and the subsequent 2015 Romanian protests .
Stephen Dolginoff is an award - winning , New York City based playwright - composer .
Kellee Maize ( born January 18 , 1980 ) is an American rapper , singer , and songwriter .
Henry Kressel ( born c. 1938 ) is an American engineer , scientist , and financial executive .
Frank W. Weston ( 1843- ? ) was an English - born and trained architect who practiced in Portland , Maine and Boston , Massachusetts .
Paul Winchell ( December 21 , 1922 -- June 24 , 2005 ) was an American ventriloquist , comedian , actor , voice actor , humanitarian and inventor whose career flourished in the 1950s and 1960s .
Guitar Pete Franklin ( January 16 , 1928 -- July 31 , 1975 ) was an African American blues singer , guitarist , pianist and songwriter .
Tor Nørretranders ( born June 20 , 1955 ) is a Danish author of popular science .
Géza Alföldy ( June 7 , 1935 -- November 6 , 2011 ) was a Hungarian Ancient historian .
Constantine Chrysomalus ( or Constantine Chrysomallus ; Greek : Κωνσταντῖνος Χρυσόμαλλος ) was a Byzantine monk who was posthumously condemned by a Synod of Constantinople as a teacher of heresies affiliated with Bogomilism and Messalianism .
Emelihter Kihleng is a Micronesian ( and more specifically Pohnpeian ) poet .
Jean - Marie de Bancalis de Maurel , marquis d'Aragon ( born 1732 at Pruines ; died 1795 at Carcassonne ) was a French diplomat and aristocrat of the Ancien Régime .
Kim Weild is a Drama Desk Award - nominated theatre director , choreographer , actor , writer and educator , living and working in New York .
Cyro Del Nero ( December 28 , 1931 -- July 30 , 2010 ) was a Brazilian scenographer and set designer .
Gail Mutrux ( born October 2 , 1945 ) is an American film producer , best known for her films Donnie Brasco , Nurse Betty , and Kinsey .
Daniela Luján ( Spanish pronunciation : ( daˈnjela luˈxan ) ; born Daniela Barrios Rodriguez April 5 , 1988 ) is a Mexican pop singer and actress .
Charles Neidich is an American classical clarinetist , composer , and conductor .
Margaret Sixel is a South African - born , Australian film editor .
Tracy Sachtjen ( /ˈsætʃən/ ; born February 20 , 1969 in Sauk Prairie , Wisconsin ) is an American curler from Lodi , Wisconsin .
David Farkas ( born November 28 , 1975 ) is an American actor and the co - founder of Polo Buddies .
Rance Howard ( born November 17 , 1928 ) is an American actor who has starred in film and on television .
R. K. Selvamani ( Tamil : ஆர். கே. செல்வமணி ) is a Tamil film director .
Angelo Russo ( born October 21 , 1961 ) is an Italian actor , known for playing police officer Agatino Catarella in Il commissario Montalbano mystery television series based on the characters and novels created by Andrea Camilleri .
Fatuma Ibrahim Ali ( Somali : Fadumo Cibraahiim Cali , Arabic : فاطمة إبراهيم علي‎ ) is a Somali - Kenyan politician .
Irakli Revishvili ( Georgian : ირაკლი რევიშვილი ; born November 3 , 1989 ) is a Georgian swimmer , who specialized in freestyle events .
Rockwell Kent ( June 21 , 1882 -- March 13 , 1971 ) was an American painter , printmaker , illustrator , and writer .
Tracy Grimshaw ( born 3 June 1960 ) is an Australian journalist and television presenter .
Alex Matthews is a white South African citizen journalist and political blogger .
Paul D. MacLean ( May 1 , 1913 -- December 26 , 2007 ) was an American physician and neuroscientist who made significant contributions in the fields of physiology , psychiatry , and brain research through his work at Yale Medical School and the National Institute of Mental Health .
Philip Warren Anderson ( born December 13 , 1923 ) is an American physicist and Nobel laureate .
Park Gun - tae ( Hangul : 박건태 ; born February 5 , 1996 ) is a South Korean actor .
Dwight Conroy Farrell ( born August 25 , 1973 ) , better known by the stage name Count Bass D , is an American rapper , record producer and multi - instrumentalist who resides in Atlanta , Georgia .
Ivan Vrdoljak ( born 22 june 1972 ) is a Croatian politician , engineer and current minister at Ministry of Economy at the Cabinet of Zoran Milanović .
Eric Nalder is an American investigative journalist based in Seattle , Washington .
Wayne M. Catalano ( July 24 , 1956 in New Orleans , Louisiana ) is a former jockey and current trainer in American Thoroughbred horse racing who has won three Breeders ' Cup World Championship races and trained two Eclipse Award Champions .
Elin Brandell ( 1882 - 1963 ) , was a Swedish journalist and author .
Martin Hadden is a British chef , who won a Michelin star at both Ockenden Manor and The Priory House .
Gary D. Roach ( born February 5 , 1964 ) , sometimes credited as Gary Roach , is an American film editor .
Gaius Volusenus Quadratus ( fl . mid-1st century BC ) was a distinguished military officer of the Roman Republic .
John Kannenberg ( Milwaukee , WI ) is a sonic and visual artist , whose work aims to evoke primal natural forces , spirituality , melancholy , nostalgia , and narrativity .
Franz Xaver Eggert ( 1802 - 1876 ) was a German glass painter
Lili Zoe Ermezei ( born as Érmezei Lili Zoé in Hungary , 1988 ) is a portrait and conceptual photographer .
Katherine Hoover ( born December 2 , 1937 , in Elkins , West Virginia ) is an American composer and flutist .
Lucy Yeomans is Editor - in - Chief of luxury online fashion website Net - a - Porter and previously editor of the fashion magazine Harper 's Bazaar in the UK .
Shaura , formerly known as Juka ( ジュカ ) , is a Japanese visual kei metal singer who first became known in 2002 when he was recruited by Mana for his project Moi dix Mois .
Leonardo Villalobos ( born September 7 , 1970 ) is a Venezuelan actor , and television personality known for hosting the shows Portada 's from 2005 until 2009 , and Súper Sábado Sensacional since 2010 .
Chung - ying Cheng ( Chinese : 成中英 ) is a Chinese philosopher and professor of philosophy at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa .
Daario Naharis a leader in the Stormcrows mercenary company .
Henry Holcomb Bennett ( December 5 , 1863 -- April 30 , 1924 ) was an American author , journalist , and poet .
Barend Alkema is a South African rugby league player who represented his country in the 1995 World Cup , playing in all three games .
John Yarde - Buller , 1st Baron Churston ( 12 April 1799 -- 4 September 1871 ) was a British , Conservative politician .
Giancarlo Petrazzuolo ( born August 7 , 1980 ) is an Italian professional tennis player who is currently inactive .
Ajay Rao ( also credited as Krishna Ajai Rao ) is an Indian actor who works primarily in Kannada film industry . He is commonly known as `` Sandalwood Krishna '' .
Jean Auguste Ulric Scheler ( 1819 - -1890 ) , also styled Auguste Scheler was a Belgian philologist .
Cyril Mann ( 1911 - -1980 ) was a British painter and sculptor who added a new dimension to figurative art by exploring the dynamic effects of sunlight in a different way from his predecessors .
Shemariah ben Mordecai was a German rabbi and tosafist of the first half of the 12th century , who was a pupil of the tosafist Isaac ben Asher .
Jasmin Hasić is a Bosnian boxer in super heavyweight best known for winning bronze medal at the European Junior Championships 2007 in Sombor .
Portuguese photographer Eduardo Gageiro is widely considered the country 's foremost photojournalist .
S. K. Vedarathinam ( தமிழ் : எஸ்.கே.வேதரெத்தினம் ) is an Indian politician and formerMember of the Legislative Assembly of Tamil Nadu .
Heike Schwaller ( born July 24 , 1968 ) is a German - Swiss curler .
Gassan Hamdan is an Iraqi scholar , poet and translator .
Yelena Yemchuk ( Ukrainian : Єлена Ємчук , born April 22 , 1970 ) is a Ukrainian professional photographer , painter and film director , best known for her work with The Smashing Pumpkins .
Andreas of Ratisbon ( sometimes Andreas of Regensburg ) was a historian of the later 14th and early 15th century .
Ricardo Viana Vargas is a Brazilian engineer , author of project management books , and current director of infrastructure ( engineering ) and project management at the United Nations Office for Project Services ( UNOPS ) .
Darijan Božič ( born in Slavonski Brod , Kingdom of Yugoslavia ( present - day Croatia ) on April 29 , 1933 ) is a Slovenian composer and conductor .
Jay Gordon ( Born : January 30 , 1967 ) is a singer , producer , journalist and video editor of Video Ask Vic .
Craig Mitnick is an American lawyer , broadcaster and businessman .
Michael Avedon ( born January 16 , 1991 ) is an American photographer living in New York City .
Tippa Irie ( real name Anthony Henry ) is a British reggae singer and DJ from Brixton , South London .
Joao Manuel Ferreira or more popularly known as Johnny Ferreira ( born on August 11 , 1957 ) , is Canadian - Portuguese saxophonist , songwriter , producer , and horn arranger , who plays in rock and roll , blues , and swing genres .
William Draper Harkins ( December 28 , 1873 -- March 7 , 1951 ) was an U.S. chemist , notably for his contributions to nuclear chemistry .
Joe Silver ( September 28 , 1922 , Chicago , Illinois - February 27 , 1989 , New York , New York ) was an American stage , television , film and radio actor .
Leyland Hodgson ( October 5 , 1892 -- March 16 , 1949 ) , also known as Leland Hodgson , was an English - born American character actor of the 1930s and 1940s .
Kim In - Soon ( Korean : 김인순 ; born April 5 , 1957 ) , better known by her stage name , Insooni ( Korean : 인순이 ) , is a South Korean singer .
Stephen Dow Beckham is a noted American historian known for his work with Native Americans and the American West , especially the Pacific Northwest and the Lewis and Clark Expedition .
George Gill Green ( January 16 , 1842 -- February 26 , 1925 ) was a patent medicine entrepreneur , and Union Colonel in the American Civil War .
Amon Adonai Santos de Araújo Tobin ( born February 7 , 1972 ) , known as Amon Tobin , is a Brazilian musician , composer and producer of electronic music .

María Isabel Soldevila Brea ( b. Santo Domingo ) is a journalist , academician , columnist , television presenter , and writer from the Dominican Republic .
Shieh Chung - liang ( Chinese : 謝忠良 ; pinyin : Xiè Zhōngliáng ; Wade -- Giles : Hsieh4 Chung1-liang2 ) is a Taiwanese journalist known for his role in a high - profile libel suit .
Valentin Gneushev ( born December 20 , 1951 ) is a Russian circus director and choreographer .
Jeremy Schloss is a former rugby league player of the 1990s for the South Sydney Rabbitohs , Gold Coast Seagulls and North Queensland Cowboys .
Charles Durrett is an American architect and author based in Nevada City , California .
Pamela Norris in an American screenwriter and producer .
Claire Falkenstein ( /ˈfɑːlkənˌstaɪn/ ; July 22 , 1908 -- October 23 , 1997 ) was an American sculptor , painter , printmaker , jewelry designer , and teacher , most renowned for her often large - scale abstract metal and glass public sculptures .
Zaurbek Baysangurov ( born March 2 , 1985 ) is a Russian boxer and the former IBO and WBO Light Middleweight Champion .
Haroon Siddiqui , CM , O.Ont ( born June 1 , 1942 ) is an Indo - Canadian newspaper journalist , columnist and a former editor .
Tezcacohuatzin ( also called Ozomatzin ) was a king of Cuauhnahuac .

Tracy Lee Stum is an American artist best known for her spectacular / large interactive 3D street paintings or chalk drawings .

Diana Karazon ( Arabic : ديانا كرزون‎ ) ( born October 30 , 1983 in Kuwait ) is a Jordanian singer of Arabic pop , television host , and actress .

Oliver Muirhead ( born May 10 , 1957 ) is an English character actor known for often portraying pompous country gentlemen .

Robert Lee Helms ( August 15 , 1933 -- June 19 , 1997 ) , known professionally as Bobby Helms , was an American country music singer who enjoyed his peak success in 1957 with the seasonal hit `` Jingle Bell Rock '' .

Tim Potter is an English actor in theatre , films and TV since the 1980s .
Garret P. Wikoff was an American Federalist Party politician , who served on the Monmouth County , New Jersey Board of Chosen Freeholders .

James Duane ( February 6 , 1733 -- February 1 , 1797 ) was an American lawyer , jurist , and Revolutionary leader from New York .
David Yazbek ( born 1961 ) is an American writer , musician , composer , and lyricist .
Jay Levin is an American journalist who was founder , editor and CEO of the LA Weekly , one of the seminal newspapers of the weekly alternative press in the United States , from 1978 to 1992 .

Caecina Mavortius Basilius Decius ( floruit 486 - 510 ) was a Roman politician under Odoacer 's rule .

Michael Baiardi ( born September 11 , 1972 in New York City ) is an American composer , songwriter and music producer who currently resides in Los Angeles , California .
Maggie Steber is an American photographer and journalist who was a director of photography for the Miami Herald and is a contributor to many magazines among of which are Newsweek and New York Times Magazine .
Abraham of Scetes was a monk who became a saint of the Coptic Church .
Rabbi Yosef Yeshaya Braun is an Orthodox rabbi and a member of the Chabad Hasidic movement .
Lucinda Ebersole is a critic , editor and writer of fiction in the literary scene of Washington , D.C. She is best known for her association with the literary journal Gargoyle Magazine , for which she has been co - editor along with Richard Peabody since 1997 .
Ainan Tasneem Binti Redzuan ( born November 4 , 1992 ) , better known as Ainan Tasneem , is a Malaysian singer who debuted in 2012 .

Naomi Harris ( born May 26 , 1973 in Toronto , Canada ) is a Canadian photographer living in New York .

Tevin Thomas is a U.S. musician , composer , keyboard artist , producer and educator .
Joseph C. Smith ( August 13 , 1883 -- March 22 , 1965 ) was a violinist , composer , dance band leader and recording artist most popular in the second and third decades of the 20th century .
Tom Walmsley ( born December 13 , 1948 in Liverpool , England ) is a Canadian playwright , novelist , poet and screenwriter .

Toby Proctor is a Canadian actor and voice actor .
Edward Brickell White ( January 29 , 1806 -- May 10 , 1882 ) , also known as E. B. White , was an American architect .
Benjamin Newhall Johnson ( June 19 , 1856 -- February 19 , 1932 ) was an American attorney and historian who owned what would become Breakheart Reservation .
Ken Hart ( May 7 , 1917 -- February 12 , 2006 ) was an American World War II pilot , publisher , composer , actor , editor , lobbyist , writer , disc jockey and campaign manager .
Kusum Mehdele is an Indian politician who is cabinet minister in Government of Madhya Pradesh .
Denzel Spencer ( born April 14 , 1996 ) , better known by his stage name Roy Woods ( stylized as Roy Wood$ ) , is a Canadian rapper and R&B musician from Brampton , Ontario .

Andrea Fellers is an American artist , film director , and producer .
Abraham of Smolensk was a monk of Smolensk , his birthplace , where he became a monk of the Bogoroditzkaja monastery .
Jean Gebser ( German : ( ˈɡeːpsɐ ) ; August 20 , 1905 -- May 14 , 1973 ) was a philosopher , a linguist , and a poet , who described the structures of human consciousness .
William B. Colleary , AIA , ( September 26 , 1890 -- August 18 , 1973 ) was an American architect active in the first half of the twentieth century .
Raja Mehdi Ali Khan(Urdu : راجہ مہدی علی خان ‎ ) was an Indian poet , writer and lyricist .

Hervé Descottes is a French lighting designer , business owner and author .
Gino Sensani ( 1888 - -1947 ) was an Italian costume designer who worked on over eighty films during his career .
Dr Mutawakkil Kazi was a noted civil servant and economist of Pakistan .
Lewis Williams Douglas ( July 2 , 1894 -- March 7 , 1974 ) was an American politician , diplomat , businessman and academic .
Borys Protsenko ( born August 21 , 1978 ) is a retired Ukrainian ice hockey player and a Russian amateur scout for the NHL 's Dallas Stars .
Pablo Pacheco Avila is a Cuban journalist who has contributed to the Ciego de Ávila Independent Journalists Cooperative ( CAPI ) .
Roman Kirn is the ambassador of the Republic of Slovenia to the USA and Mexico .
Luiz R. S. Simmons ( born January 27 , 1949 ) is an American politician who represents the 17th legislative district of the state of Maryland in the Maryland House of Delegates .
Pearn P. Niiler ( 1937 , Tartu , Estonia , died October 15 , 2010 , San Diego ) - American oceanographer .
Ronald C. Kessler ( born April 26 , 1947 ) is an American sociologist and a professor of health care policy at Harvard Medical School .
Steve De Jarnatt is an American film and television director , screenwriter , and short - story author .
Don Hay ( born February 13 , 1954 ) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player and National Hockey League head coach .
William Roe Howell ( April 9 , 1846 - December 30 , 1890 ) was a prominent New York City photographer of the 1870s , known mostly for portraits of political and theatrical celebrities .
Robin Driscoll is a British actor and writer , best known as a writer of Mr. Bean .
Véronique Morin is a Canadian science journalist who has worked for over 25 years to the dissemination and popularization of science .
Stieg Trenter married the author Ulla Trenter in 1960 .
Félix W. Ortiz ( born November 2 , 1959 in Puerto Rico ) is an American politician , currently representing New York 's 51st Assembly District .
Craig Priestly is an Australian - American rugby league player who represented his country in the 2013 World Cup .
Jaime Benítez Rexach ( October 29 , 1908 -- May 30 , 2001 ) was a Puerto Rican author , academic and politician .
Joshua Swanson is an American theater actor , film actor and television actor , voice over talent and a prolific , award - winning narrator of audiobooks with over 100 titles to his name , including This Book Is Not Good for You , all three novels of The Longlight Legacy , Peeps and Hairstyles of the Damned .
William A. Paxton ( 1837 -- July 18 , 1907 ) was an American pioneer businessman and politician in Omaha , Nebraska .
John L. Harmer ( born April 28 , 1934 ) is a former California politician who served in the California State Senate as a Republican from 1966 to 1974 .
Geoffrey von Maltzahn , PhD ( born July 22 , 1980 ) is an American biological engineer , inventor , and entrepreneur in biotechnology and nanotechnology .
Athanas Sina , also known as Thanas Sina , was an Albanian journalist , teacher and activist of the Albanian National Awakening .
Daniel Stabrawa ( born August 23 , 1955 in Kraków ) is a Polish violinist and conductor .
Joe Arlooktoo ( born June 26 , 1939 ) is a northern Canadian artist , adept at soapstone and ivory carving , and a municipal and territorial - level politician who was a member of the Northwest Territories Legislature from 1979 until 1991 .
Scott Christopher ( born January 13 , 1967 ) is an American actor who has had key roles in such films as Mobsters and Mormons and The Best Two Years .
Gianpaolo Venuta ( also known as Gian Paolo Venuta or Gian - Paolo Venuta ) is a Canadian actor .
Christopher Bramwell is a British actor who was active on television from 1977 until 1996 .
Dick Crockett ( February 27 , 1915 -- January 25 , 1979 ) , born Richard DeHart Crockett , was an American television and film actor , stunt performer , stunt coordinator , producer , and director .
Barbara Rose ( born 1938 ) is an American art historian and art critic .
John Verkamp ( born c. 1940 ) is an American attorney and politician in Arizona ; he served as a county attorney for 12 years , and was elected to four terms as a Republican state representative .
Gautam Navlakha ( Hindi pronunciation : ( ɡɔːt̪ m nʋlkʰaː ) ) is a civil liberties , democratic , and human rights activist ; and a journalist .
Maury Henry Biddle Paul ( April 14 , 1890 -- July 17 , 1942 ) was an American journalist who became famous as a society columnist for the New York American ( which became the New York Journal - American when it merged with the New York Evening Journal ) .
George Edward Massee ( 20 December 1845 - 16 February 1917 ) was an English mycologist , plant pathologist , and botanist .
George Anastasia ( born February 5 , 1947 , in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania ) is an American author and was a long - time writer for The Philadelphia Inquirer .
Cecep Syamsul Hari ( born on May 1 , 1967 in Bandung , West Java ) is an Indonesian poet .
Vytautas Pociūnas ( September 1957 -- August 23 , 2006 ) was a physicist , officer of the Lithuanian State Security Department , and diplomat .
Harry Nicolaides ( born 1967 or 1968 ) is an Australian writer of Greek - Cypriot origin imprisoned in Thailand under the Thai lèse majesté law , for a passage in a 2005 novel of his deemed to defame the Thai monarchy .
Howard Tracy Hall ( October 20 , 1919 -- July 25 , 2008 ) was an American physical chemist , and the first person who grew a synthetic diamond according to a reproducible , verifiable and witnessed process , using a press of his own design .
Susan Gerhart is a semi - retired computer scientist .
Matt Dellinger is a journalist and writer who has written for The New Yorker , the Atlantic , the Oxford American , Smithsonian , and the New York Times and has reported on transportation and planning for the public radio show The Takeaway .
Tormod Bjørnetun Haugen ( /2turmud 2bjøːn̺eˌtʉːn 1hæʋgen/ , born 28 October 1988 ) is a Norwegian speed skater and inline skater representing Sandefjord SK .
Aoiyama Kōsuke ( 碧山 亘右 ) ( born June 19 , 1986 as Daniel Ivanov , Bulgarian : Даниел Иванов , in Elhovo , Bulgaria ) is a professional sumo wrestler or rikishi .
Michael Hafftka is an American figurative expressionist painter living in New York City .
César Costa is a Mexican actor and rock - and - roll singer .
Hamid Chitchian ( Persian / Azeri : حمید چیت‌چیان , born c. 1957 ) is an Iranian politician and the former intelligence head .
Domenico Carnovale was an Italian painter and architect , active mainly in his native Modena .
Valentina Artemyeva is a Russian breaststroke swimmer .
Cirilo Nelson ( born July 30 , 1938 ) is a Honduran botanist and researcher at the Department of Biology of the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Honduras .
Tom Kading is an American politician , business owner , and lawyer .
Fred Doerr was an American politician who served as the 39th Mayor of San Jose , California , from 1928 to 1930 .
John Lloyd Wright ( December 12 , 1892 -- December 20 , 1972 ) was an American architect and toy inventor .
Snejana Petrova Sapir is a Russian ballroom dancer , most known for being the champion of the Second Dance World Championship celebrated in Mexico .
Chris Beal ( born August 6 , 1985 ) is an American mixed martial artist who competes in the bantamweight division of the Ultimate Fighting Championship ( UFC ) .
Jerry DeCaire is a freelance comic artist .
Ari Guðmundsson ( September 14 , 1927 -- 2003 ) was an Icelandic ski jumper who competed in the 1950s .
Seth Gilliard , also Seth G , ( born 1989 or 1990 ) is a South Carolina violinist who covers pop tunes .
Tung - Yen Lin ( Chinese : 林同棪 ; pinyin : Lín Tóngyán ; November 14 , 1912 -- November 15 , 2003 ) was a structural engineer who was the pioneer of standardizing the use of prestressed concrete .
Jérémie Carboni is a French director , screenwriter , actor , producer and was a political communication advisor .
Quintus Marcius Turbo was prefect of the Praetorian Guard and a close friend and military advisor to both emperor Trajan and Hadrian during the early 2nd century .
Tanya Boeva ( Bulgarian:Таня Боева ; born November 3 , 1973 ) is a Bulgarian pop and Chalga singer .
Fabian Sanchez is a professional dancer born in New York City , New York , who grew up in Colombia .
Baayork Lee ( born December 5 , 1946 ) is an Asian - American actress , singer , dancer , choreographer , theatre director , and author .
Reed Hadley ( born Reed Herring ; June 25 , 1911 -- December 11 , 1974 ) was an American film , television and radio actor .
Daniel J. Sullivan ( born June 10 , 1940 ) is an American theatre and film director and playwright .
Ruth Payne Burgess , ( October 11 , 1865 in Montpelier , Vermont -- March 11 , 1934 in New York ) , was a naturalistic painter of portraits , still lifes , and genre work .
Jenna Rose Swerdlow ( born September 28 , 1998 ) , best known as Jenna Rose , is an American teenage singer who gained media attention , as a pre - teen , with her single `` My Jeans '' .
Kumud Dhital ( Nepali : कुमुद िधताल ) , FRCS , PhD is a cardiothoracic specialist and transplant surgeon at St Vincent 's Hospital , Sydney , Australia .
Piotr Wilczek ( born April 26 , 1962 ) is a Polish intellectual historian , specialist in Comparative Literature and literary translator .
Peter Laszlo Peri ( June 13 , 1899 -- January 19 , 1967 ) was an artist and sculptor .
Peter G. Tsouras is a military historian and author .
Sally Gilpin was an English ballet dancer and choreographer .
Solon Nikitas ( October 1 , 1937 -- October 22 , 2005 ) was a distinguished Cypriot judge and jurist .

Kurt Westerfeld is a software developer who lives in Virginia .
Kip Kubin ( born March 4 , 1965 ) is an American film director , producer , writer , musician , and sound designer .
Shukria Barakzai is an Afghan politician , journalist and entrepreneur , and a prominent Muslim feminist .

Nathan Ryno Smith ( May 21 , 1797 -- July 3 , 1877 ) was an American surgeon and medical school professor .
Viking Moses ( or The Viking Moses ! ) is a band fronted by Brendon Massei , an American songwriter noted for being on tour since 1993 .
Ian Anthony Dale ( born July 3 , 1978 ) is an American actor of Japanese , French and English descent .
Kendra Preston Leonard ( born June 11 , 1974 , New Orleans ) is a musicologist specializing in women in music and music and screen history in 20th century France , Britain , and America .
Tom Ammiano ( born December 15 , 1941 ) is an American politician and LGBT rights activist from San Francisco , California .
Clifford Smyth ( born 1934 ) is a historian and former politician in Northern Ireland .
Dru Lavigne is a network and systems administrator , IT instructor , technical writer and director at FreeBSD Foundation .
Maiken Nedergaard is a Danish neuroscientist who discovered the glymphatic system while working at the University of Rochester Medical Center .
Primož Ramovš ( March 20 , 1921 -- January 10 , 1999 ) was a Slovenian composer and librarian .
Professor Konrad Seppelt is a chemist who leads a research group at the Institute of Inorganic and Analytical Chemistry , Freie Universität Berlin ( Institut für Anorganische und Analytische Chemie der Freien Universität Berlin ) .
Li Yundi ( simplified Chinese : 李云迪 ; traditional Chinese : 李雲迪 ; pinyin : Lǐ Yúndí ) ( born October 7 , 1982 ) is a Chinese classical pianist .
Terry Rusling ( 1931 - November 27 , 1974 ) was a Canadian electronic music composer , who used graphic notation .
Sydney Austen Cowper ( 13 October 1885 -- 17 June 1960 ) was a South African - born cricketer whose six - match first - class career spanned from 1908 to 1924 .
Jose Garces is an Ecuadorian American chef , restaurant owner , and Iron Chef .
Ernesto Juan Castellanos is a Cuban freelance author , translator , educator , journalist , producer , filmmaker , and researcher who currently lives and works in Miami .
Odunlade Adekola ( born December 31 , 1978 ) is a Nigerian actor , Singer , film - maker , producer and director .
Chad Marshall ( known by his stage name , Rowdy Rebel ) is an American rapper from Brooklyn who is signed to Epic Records .
Panagiotis Verdes is the Greek inventor of the 6x6x6 , 7x7x7 , 8x8x8 and 9x9x9 Twisty Puzzles .
Chen Cheng - jia ( Chinese : 陳成家 ; pinyin : Chén Chéngjiā ) is a politician in the Republic of China .
Woody Deck ( born June 8 , 1983 in Nashville , TN ) is an American professional poker player residing in Vilnius , Lithuania .
Franz Karl Basler - Kopp ( 1879 - -1937 ) was a Swiss painter , best known for his illustrations of Swiss fairy tales .
Gaudencio Sillona III ( born February 1 , 1981 ) , who performs under the mononym Jay R , is a Filipino singer - songwriter , actor , record producer and model .
Sir Antoine - Aimé Dorion , PC ( January 17 , 1818 -- May 31 , 1891 ) was a French Canadian politician and jurist .
Sal Restivo ( born 1940 ) is a sociologist / anthropologist .
Trevor Denis ApIvor ( April 14 , 1916 -- May 27 , 2004 ) was a British composer , part of the generation of modernists that included Humphrey Searle and Elisabeth Lutyens .
Boone Speed ( born August 29 , 1965 ) is an award - winning American photographer and influential figure within the sport of rock climbing .
Dan Voiculescu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈdan vojkuˈlesku ) ; born September 25 , 1946 ) was a Romanian politician and businessman .
Donato da Cascia ( also da Firenze or da Florentia ) ( fl . c. 1350 -- 1370 ) was an Italian composer of the Trecento .
Wayne Grigsby is a Canadian screenwriter and producer , mainly for television .

Matt Andersen is a Juno Awards nominated Canadian blues guitarist and singer - songwriter , from Perth - Andover , New Brunswick , signed to True North Records .

Dave Kleis ( born January 21 , 1964 ) is a Minnesota politician , and the mayor of St. Cloud , Minnesota .

Victoria Mallory ( September 20 , 1948 -- August 30 , 2014 ) was an American singer and actress , best known for originating the role of Anne Egerman in the Broadway musical A Little Night Music .

Giuseppe Angelini , known as la Regina ( circa 1675 - November 20 , 1751 ) was an Italian painter .

Michel Sogny is a pianist , composer and doctor of philosophy who developed a new approach to teaching the piano .

Siri Kaur is an artist / photographer who lives and works in Los Angeles , where she also serves as Associate Professor at Otis College of Art and Design .
David R. Bryant ( born May 8 , 1936 in Greensboro , North Carolina , USA ) is an internationally acclaimed organic chemist , having worked his entire thirty - nine - year `` early career '' at Union Carbide .
Peter Marinker is a London - based actor well known for his work on BBC Radio , his many audio book recordings and his association with publisher John Calder and the works of Samuel Beckett .
Gyula Y. Katona ( born December 4 , 1965 ) is a Hungarian mathematician , the son of mathematician Gyula O. H. Katona .
George Rockingham Gilmer ( April 11 , 1790 -- November 16 , 1859 ) was an American statesman and politician .
Jonathan Borofsky ( born December 24 , 1942 ) is an American sculptor and printmaker who lives and works in Ogunquit , Maine .
Alexander of Aphrodisias ( Greek : Ἀλέξανδρος ὁ Ἀφροδισιεύς ; fl . 200 AD ) was a Peripatetic philosopher and the most celebrated of the Ancient Greek commentators on the writings of Aristotle .
Neravanda Aiyappa , aka NC Aiyappa ( born 19 October 1979 ) , is an Indian first - class cricketer .
William Maclay Awl ( May 24 , 1799 -- November 19 , 1876 ) was a psychiatrist , a politician and a mental health hospital administrator .
Johnny Trí Nguyễn ( born 16 January 1974 ; Ho Chi Minh City , Vietnam ) is a Vietnamese American actor , stuntman and martial arts choreographer who is mainly active in the Vietnamese film industry .
Maksim Mrvica ( Croatian pronunciation : ( mâksim mr̩̂ʋitsa ) ; born May 3 , 1975 ) is a Croatian pianist .

Cyril J. Mockridge ( August 6 , 1896 - January 18 , 1979 ) was an English film and television composer who composed the scores for such films as Cheaper by the Dozen , River of No Return and The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance .
John Vaughan Thompson FLS ( November 19 , 1779 -- January 21 , 1847 ) was a British military surgeon , marine biologist , zoologist , botanist , and published naturalist .
I m Ho ( born January 27 , 1970 ) is a South Korean actor , perhaps best known for playing King Jungjong in the television series Dae Jang Geum and Yeon Namsaeng in the TV series Dae Jo Yeong .

Bruce Korte ( born in Muenster , Saskatchewan ) is a Canadian curler from Saskatoon .
Tommie Young ( born January 14 , 1949 ) is an American soul and gospel singer from Dallas , Texas .
Stu Silver is an American screenwriter and television writer best known for such films and television series as Throw Momma from the Train , It 's A Living , Bosom Buddies and Soap .
Adrian McAdam ( born 12 March 1971 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with North Melbourne in the Australian Football League ( AFL ) during the early 1990s .
Arthur J. Fletman , commonly known as Art Feltman , is an American politician from the state of Connecticut .
Kasper Goski ( died 1576 ) was a Polish doctor , astrologer and the mayor of Poznań .
Barry Shulman ( born May 8 , 1946 ) is an American poker player who has enjoyed success in competitive poker tournaments over the past 15 years , and is the CEO of CardPlayer Magazine .
Claire Armstrong is a British amateur astronomer .
Gary Robichaud ( September 13 , 1962 -- September 8 , 2005 ) was a Canadian teacher and politician , and leader of the Island New Democrats political party in the province of Prince Edward Island .
Bill Homans , professionally known as `` Watermelon Slim '' , is an American blues musician .
Scipione Stella ( 1558 or 1559 -- May 20 , 1622 ) was a Neapolitan composer .
Gary Adler is an American composer and musical director based in New York .
Ollie Mitchell ( April 8 , 1927 -- May 11 , 2013 ) was an American musician and bandleader .
Lisa Randall ( born June 18 , 1962 ) is an American theoretical physicist and an expert on particle physics and cosmology .
Philip Drucker ( 1911 - -1982 ) was an American anthropologist and archaeologist who specialized in the Native American peoples of the Northwest Coast of North America .
Adelaide Orsola Appignani ( 1807 - 30 September 1884 ) was an Italian singer , conductor , music educator and composer .
Alexander Herrmann ( February 10 , 1844 -- December 17 , 1896 ) was a French magician , better known as Herrmann the Great .
David Crowley ( March 25 , 1937 -- January 16 , 2011 ) was a politician from Cincinnati , Ohio who served on the Cincinnati City Council and as Vice - Mayor of the city .
Otto Torsten Andersson ( June 6 , 1926 -- May 30 , 2009 ) was a Swedish modernist painter , best known for his theme of the realistic depiction of abstract sculptures , and two - dimensional exploration of three - dimensional objects , where the colors seem to be superimposed on a random and perfunctory manner .
Scola ( born Rufus Waller on March 2 , 1978 ) is an African - American singer and musician .
Dona Spring ( January 22 , 1953 -- July 13 , 2008 ) was an American activist and Green Party politician .
May French Sheldon is noted as a translator of Flaubert 's Salammbô , and author of papers and essays , but acquired fame for an expedition .
Sunanda K. Datta - Ray has been a Bengali journalist for half a century .
Essra Mohawk ( born Sandra Elayne Hurvitz on April 23 , 1948 ) is an American singer - songwriter who has recorded a dozen albums , many receiving critical acclaim .
Susan Gibson is a Wimberley , Texas based singer and songwriter who has released four solo albums and tours the nation .
Max Adalbert ( February 19 , 1874 -- September 7 , 1933 ) was a German stage and movie actor .

Blair Lancaster is a Canadian businesswoman and politician from Burlington , Ontario .

Angharad James ( 1677 - -1749 ) was a farmer , a harpist , and a poet .

Abbott Lawrence Rotch ( January 6 , 1861 -- April 7 , 1912 ) was an American meteorologist and founder of the Blue Hill Meteorological Observatory , the longest continually operating observation site in the United States and an important site for world climatology .

Willoughby Williams was an American war veteran and politician from North Carolina .
Pong Sarasin ( Thai : พงส์ สารสิน ) is a Thai businessman and a retired politician who served under Major General Chatichai Choonhavan 's cabinet , acting as Deputy Prime Minister along with General Tienchai Sirisumpan in 1988 .
Dhruv Narayan Singh ( born July 26 , 1959 ) is an Indian politician active in Madhya Pradesh State of India .
Mabel Boll ( December 1 , 1893 -- April 11 , 1949 ) , known as the `` Queen of Diamonds '' , was an American socialite involved in the early days of record - setting flights in the 1920s .

Deb Margolin is an American performance artist and playwright .
Stefan Georg ( Ralf - Stefan Georg , born November 7 , 1962 in Bottrop ) is a German linguist .
Andy Wear is an English actor born in Lancaster , Lancashire , England .
Michael Channing is a professional rugby league player for the Featherstone Rovers in the Kingstone Press Championship .
Wendy Melvoin is the daughter of late jazz pianist ( and former NARAS president ) Mike Melvoin who in the 1960s was part of the Los Angeles session musician collective The Wrecking Crew .

Graham Hancock ( /ˈhænkɒk/ ; born 2 August 1950 ) is a British writer and journalist .
Mercedes Reaves is a Puerto Rican research engineer and scientist .
Tony Skole is an American college baseball coach , currently serving as head coach of the East Tennessee State Buccaneers baseball team .
Mukhtar Siddique ( Belarusian : মুখতার সিদ্দিক ) is a First class and List A cricketer from Bangladesh .
Pieter de Groot ( March 28 , 1615 -- June 2 , 1678 ) was a Dutch regent and diplomat during the First Stadtholderless Period of the Dutch Republic .
Frank Eugene Corder ( May 26 , 1956 -- September 12 , 1994 ) was an American truck driver .
Eugene Gonsalves is an Indian entrepreneur and has held leadership positions in religious organizations such as the Catholic Association of Bengal and the All India Catholic Union .
Patrick Manogue ( May 28 , 1831 -- February 27 , 1895 ) was a miner ' 49er , pioneer priest and the founding Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Sacramento , California .
Andrew Mogrelia is a British classical conductor specializing in ballet .
Robert Waleys ( fl . 1373 - -1388 ) of Ipswich , Suffolk , was an English politician .
Pablo García González , known as Tito García ( 1931 - -2003 ) was a Spanish actor .
William Beecher Scoville ( January 13 , 1906 - February 25 , 1984 ) was a neurosurgeon at Hartford Hospital .
S. Krishnamurthi ( full name and details unknown ) was an Indian cricketer who played for Hyderabad .
Martin Birch is a British former music producer and sound engineer , who became renowned for engineering and producing albums by the British rock bands Deep Purple and Iron Maiden .
Edgar Barrier ( March 4 , 1907 -- June 20 , 1964 ) was an American actor who appeared on radio , stage , and screen .
Merle Boucher ( born July 19 , 1946 ) is a North Dakota Democratic - NPL Party politician who served in the North Dakota House of Representatives , representing the 9th district from 1991 to 2011 .
Howard Blake OBE ( born 28 October 1938 ) is an English composer whose career has spanned over 50 years and produced more than 650 works .
William Morgan DeBeck ( April 15 , 1890 -- November 11 , 1942 ) , better known as Billy DeBeck , was an American cartoonist .
Elio Fox is an American professional poker player whose first World Series of Poker ( WSOP ) in the money finish was the 2011 World Series of Poker Europe main event that he won .
Moncacht - Apé was a Native American explorer of the Yazoo tribe in the present - day Mississippi area ; in the early 1700s he may have made the first recorded roundtrip transcontinental journey across North America .
Constantine Ó Nialláin , ( aka Constantine O'Nelan ) Irish soldier and Capuchin friar , c. 1560?-after 1621 .
Jerry Schatzberg ( born June 26 , 1927 in Bronx , New York ) is a photographer and film director .
Jacqueline Felice de Almania , ( in Italian : Jacobina Félicie ) , ( fl . 1322 ) was an Italian physician active in Paris , France .
Marcus Stock was ordained a priest in 1988 by the Archbishop of Birmingham Maurice Couve de Murville and served in parishes across the Archdiocese of Birmingham .
Lynne Taylor - Corbett is a choreographer , director , lyricist , and composer .
Noah Brooks ( October 24 , 1830 -- August 16 , 1903 ) was a journalist and editor who worked for newspapers in Sacramento , San Francisco , Newark , and New York , and authored a major biography of Abraham Lincoln based on close personal observation .
Benedetto Possenti ( active in the 17th century ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period , active mainly as a battle painter , as well of seaports , landscapes , and festivals .
Traveling through Europe as a fashion model , Kim Alley set the stage for her success by landing high profile campaigns for Lancôme , Evian , and Benetton and was featured in such top fashion magazines as French Vogue , Italian Vogue , Italian Bazaar , and American Elle Magazine .
Sinan Erdem ( May 9 , 1927-July 23 , 2003 ) was a former Turkish volleyball player and long - standing head of the National Olympic Committee of Turkey .
Pompeia Paulina ( /pɒmˈpiːə , -ˈpeɪə , pɔːˈlaɪnə/ ) was the wife of the statesman , philosopher , and orator Lucius Annaeus Seneca , and she was part of a circle of educated Romans who sought to lead a principled life under the emperor Nero .
Henri Wittmann ( born 1937 ) is a Canadian linguist from Quebec .
De Volson Wood ( June 1 , 1832 -- June 27 , 1897 ) was American civil engineer and educator .
Ernst Victor Wolff ( Aug 6 , 1889 - -August 21 , 1960 ) was a German - born concert pianist and harpsichordist who maintained a career not only as a soloist but also as a respected accompanist .
Charles Montague Bakewell ( April 24 , 1867 -- September 19 , 1957 ) was a university professor and Republican politician .
Fred Overton , Jr. is a former head basketball coach at Murray State University and currently a nationwide motivational speaker .
Khawaja Muhammad Safdar was a famous politician from Pakistan Muslim League .
Paul Murry ( November 25 , 1911 -- August 4 , 1989 ) was an American cartoonist and comics artist .
Baron Alberto Fassini ( 1875 - 1942 ) was an Italian business tycoon and film producer .
Carl Romanelli is an American sculptor noted for his many outdoor sculptures of famous people .
Andressa Fernandes Corrêa ( born October 27 , 1986 in Santos , São Paulo ) is a Brazilian judoka , who played for the half - lightweight category .
John Melhuish was an English merchant and politician .
Michael Francis Howley ( September 25 , 1843 -- October 15 , 1914 ) was a Roman Catholic priest and Archbishop of St. John 's , Newfoundland from 1904 to 1914 .
Ishwar Maraj ( Hindi : इश्वर माराज ; born January 26 , 1969 in Point Fortin , Trinidad and Tobago ) is a Canadian cricketer .
John LeConte ( December 4 , 1818 -- April 29 , 1891 ) was an American scientist and academic .

Shellie Morris is an indigenous Australian singer / songwriter who plays a mix of contemporary folk music and contemporary acoustic ballads .
Adrian Minune ( real name Adrian Simionescu , born September 24 , 1974 ) is a Romani - Romanian manele singer .

Pete Sheppard ( born March 26 , 1967 , in Providence , Rhode Island ) is an Italian - American radio host , formerly heard on WEEI 93.7 FM in Boston .
Haraden Pratt ( July 18 , 1891 - August 1 , 1969 ) was a noted American electrical engineer and radio pioneer .
Aron Pumnul ( November 27 , 1818 Cuciulata , district of Braşov - January 12/24 , 1866 , Chernivtsi ) was a Romanian philologist and teacher , national and revolutionary activist in Transylvania and later in Bucovina ( then in the Habsburg Monarchy ) .
Richard Yeoman - Clark is a British composer and sound engineer who worked at the BBC Radiophonic Workshop from 1970 to 1978 .
Miguel Deynes Soto ( born July 5 , 1936 , in Moca , Puerto Rico ) is a Puerto Rican politician and former Senator .
Elyse Knox ( born Elsie Lillian Kornbrath : December 14 , 1917 -- February 16 , 2012 ) was an American actress , model , and fashion designer .
Daniel Read ( November 16 , 1757 -- December 4 , 1836 ) was an American composer of the First New England School , and one of the primary figures in early American classical music .
David B. Richman is an American arachnologist and curator of the Arthropod Museum at New Mexico State University .
Jean - Docile Brousseau ( February 24 , 1825 -- July 28 , 1908 ) was a Canadian politician and newspaper owner .
Györgyi Őri ( née Győrvári , born October 11 , 1955 in Békéscsaba ) is a former Hungarian handball player and multiple World Championship medalist .
Julien Nitzberg ( born 1965 ) is a US screenwriter , stage writer , lyricist , theater director and film director , best known in the film world as the director of the documentary The Wild and Wonderful Whites of West Virginia .
Byron Lawson ( born August 26 , 1968 ) is a Canadian actor of Cantonese , Japanese , and Korean descent .
Byron G. Harlan ( August 29 , 1861 -- September 11 , 1936 ) was an American singer from Kansas , a comic minstrel singer and balladeer who often recorded with Arthur Collins .
David Polak is an American business executive and philanthropist from Beverly Hills , California .
Kathy Flores ( born February 7 , 1955 ) is a former rugby union player from the United States and was the Head Coach of the U.S. Women 's National Team until Jan. 2011 and currently Head Coach of the Brown Women 's Rugby Team .
Eugenius Roche ( 1786 - -1829 ) was an Anglo - French journalist .
Mike Hay is a Scottish curler and curling coach .
John Edmonds Kozma ( born January 25 , 1972 ) is an American director , actor , producer , cinematographer , and founder of Bang Productions .
Héctor Marcó or stage name Hector Sunday Marcolongo ( 1906 - -1987 ) was an Argentine composer who focused mainly on the tango genre .
Andrew J. Rausch is an American film journalist , author , screenwriter , film producer , and actor .
Gary Robinson is an American software engineer and inventor notable for his mathematical algorithms to fight spam .
Andrew Kenny is the main singer / songwriter of The Wooden Birds , which released their debut LP Magnolia in May 2009 .
William Howard Brett ( July 1 , 1846 -- August 24 , 1918 ) was head librarian for the Cleveland Public Library from 1884 to 1918 .

T. Rathinavel ( born January 1 , 1951 ; Srivilliputhur , District- Virudhunagar ( Tamil Nadu ) ) is a politician .

Libby Weaver is an Australian author , speaker and nutritional biochemist .

Diana Diamond is an American journalist who has edited a number of newspapers including the Palo Alto Daily News , and was a columnist at the Palo Alto Weekly .
Alice Wu ( 伍思薇 ) is a Chinese American film director and screenwriter .
Edward Cowles , an American psychiatrist , was the Medical Superintendent of the McLean Hospital in Massachusetts from 1879 to 1903 .
Donald Justice ( August 12 , 1925 -- August 6 , 2004 ) was an American poet and teacher of writing .

Howard Kassinove ABPP is a psychologist who works in the area of anger and anger management .
Oliver Ellsworth Buckley ( August 8 , 1887 -- December 14 , 1959 ) was an American electrical engineer known for his contributions to the field of submarine telephony .
Major General ( Retired ) Bruce M. Lawlor ( born January 24 , 1948 ) is a retired United States Army officer .
Anne Arnold , ( May 2 , 1925- June 20 , 2014 ) was a sculptor best known for her whimsical life - size and sometimes larger than life - size sculptures of animals and people rendered in wood , ceramic , or softer materials such as canvas and Dynel , and resins .
Nick Cullather is an American historian and professor of history at Indiana University .
Bob Ellison is an American screenwriter and producer for television .
Elettra Rossellini Wiedemann ( born July 26 , 1983 ) is an American food editor and writer , fashion model , and socialite of Italian , Swedish , French , and German descent .

Siniša Žugić ( Serbian : Синиша Жугић ) ( born December 17 , 1969 ) is a Serbian diver .

Harold Levinson is an American psychiatrist and author , best known for developing the cerebellar theory of treating dyslexia .

Amanda Inez Knight Allen ( September 8 , 1876 -- June 5 , 1937 ) was a Mormon missionary and a Utah politician .

Cameron Hitchcock is an Australian rules footballer who played for Port Adelaide in the AFL .
Sanaa Hamri ( born November 15 , 1974 ; Arabic : سناء حمري‎ ) is a Moroccan American film director , music video director , television director , and television producer .

Otto Kuhler ( July 31 , 1894 -- August 5 , 1977 ) was an American designer , one of the best known industrial designers of the American railroads .

Csaba Csáki is a theoretical physicist who studied under Lisa Randall .
Amy Cohen Banker is an internationally exhibited American abstract painter .

Trax Colton ( born Louis A. Morelli on May 26 , 1929 ) is an American motion picture actor who was a contract player for 20th Century Fox from 1960 to 1962 .
Joseph Bruchac ( born October 16 , 1942 ) is a writer of books relating to the Indigenous peoples of the Americas , with a particular focus on northeastern Native American and Anglo - American lives and folklore .
Joshua Friedman is an American journalist who worked 32 years for newspapers and won a Pulitzer Prize in 1985 .
Roy D'Arcy ( February 10 , 1894 -- November 15 , 1969 ) was an American film actor of the silent film and early sound period of the 1930s noted for his portrayal of flamboyant villains .
Karol Stricker ( May 21 , 1959-January 14 , 2008 ) was an American painter of fine porcelain .
Henry Wharton Conway ( March 18 , 1793 -- November 9 , 1827 ) was a United States naval officer during the War of 1812 and a politician in Arkansas Territory , who was elected as a territorial delegate ( 1823 - -1827 ) to the United States House of Representatives for three consecutive congresses .
Thomas M. Countryman is a career diplomat who has been the United States Assistant Secretary of State for International Security and Nonproliferation since September 27 , 2011 .
Townsend Coleman ( born May 28 , 1954 ) is an American voice actor who performed in many animated series and TV commercials beginning in the early 1980s .
William Kirk Baltz ( born September 14 , 1959 ) is an American actor , perhaps best known for portraying Officer Marvin Nash in Reservoir Dogs ( 1992 ) .
Before becoming active as a painter in Stockholm , Sweden , Jacques Foucquet was employed as an officer and engineer in the court of Louis XIV .
Robert Joffrey ( born Abdullah Jaffa Bey Khan ; December 24 , 1930 -- March 25 , 1988 ) was an American dancer , teacher , producer , choreographer , and co - founder of the Joffrey Ballet , known for his highly imaginative modern ballets .

Ricardo Tirloni ( born February 3 , 1983 ) is a Brazilian mixed martial artist who competes in the lightweight division .
Mikko Hietanen ( 1911 - -1999 ) was a Finnish long - distance runner , European Champion and world record holder , who competed for his native country at the Summer Olympics in London 1948 and in Helsinki 1952 .
A. James Rudin is an American rabbi noted for his work in inter - religious affairs .
Elizabeth Wentworth Roberts ( June 10 , 1871 -- March 12 , 1927 ) was an American painter who lived and worked in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , Paris , and Concord , Massachusetts .

Lyall Brooks ( born November 16 , 1978 ) is an Australian actor who has appeared on TV , film and stage .
Fred Sersen ( February 24 , 1890 -- December 11 , 1962 ) was a Czechoslovak / American painter and cinema special effects artist working mainly at 20th Century Fox Studios from the 1930s to the 1950s with credits in over 200 movies .
Patrick Morse is a social activist , actor , and singer .
Timo Lahtinen ( born 24 May 1947 ) is a retired Finnish ice hockey player , now working as an ice hockey coach for the Romanian team of HSC Csíkszereda .
Steve Dunwell is an American photographer noted for his color photographs of urban and scenic landscapes .
Jerome Robbins ( October 11 , 1918 -- July 29 , 1998 ) was an American choreographer , director , and theater producer who worked in classical ballet , on Broadway , and in films and television .

Ariful Haque ( Bengali : আরিফুল হক ) is a First class and List A cricketer from Bangladesh .
