Martin Spellman ( born October 8 , 1925 in Des Moines , Iowa ) , was an American child actor active in films during the 1930s and 1940s .
David Elkind ( born March 11 , 1931 ) is a Jewish - American child psychologist and author .
Alain Sarde is a French film producer and actor .
Antonio Talens Taberna , Jr. , also known as Anthony Taberna or Ka Tunying , ( born January 16 , 1975 ) is a Filipino broadcast journalist and radio commentator .
Colette Cassidy is a television news reporter , journalist , writer , and speaker .
Souléymane Sy Savané is an actor who starred in the 2008 film Goodbye Solo .
Anthony Van Laast is a choreographer , mainly for the stage , concerts , television and film .
Denyse Thomasos ( October 10 , 1964 - July 19 , 2012 ) was a Trinidadian - Canadian painter known primarily for large - scale , abstract works .
Cleitagora or Clitagora ( Greek : Κλειταγόρας ) was a Spartan lyric poet mentioned by Aristophanes in his Wasps and his lost play the Danaids .
James Brody ( July 13 , 1941 -- April 11 , 2010 ) was an American composer , born in Clearfield , Pennsylvania .
Jim True - Frost ( born Jim True ; July 31 , 1966 ) is an American stage , television and screen actor .
Joris Laarman ( born October 24 , 1979 ) is a Dutch designer , artist and entrepreneur best known for his experimental designs inspired by emerging technologies .
Frank Bencriscutto ( September 21 , 1928 -- August 28 , 1997 ) , nicknamed `` Dr. Ben , '' was an American conductor and composer of concert band music .
William Frederick Fisher ( born April 1 , 1946 ) is an American physician and a former NASA astronaut .
Ellen Palmer Allerton ( October 17 , 1835 -- August 31 , 1893 ) , was an American poet whose inspiration probably came from her life on farms in rural New York , Wisconsin , and Kansas .
Josephine Skriver ( born April 14 , 1993 ) is a Danish model known for her work with fashion and beauty brands like Victoria 's Secret , Gucci , Max Mara , Michael Kors , Bulgari , and DKNY .
Raymond Rushabiro is a Ugandan film actor , and stage actor .
Melanie Hudson is an English actress and comedian , one half of the double act Hudson and Pepperdine along with Vicki Pepperdine .
Derrick Tseng ( born 1954 ) is an American independent film producer based in New York City .
Josef Heumann ( born October 14 , 1964 ) was a West German - German ski jumper who competed from 1981 to 1992 .
Cameron Ezike Giles ( born February 4 , 1976 ) , better known by his stage name Cam'ron ( formerly Killa Cam ) , is an American rapper , actor and entrepreneur from Harlem , New York .
Eryck Abecassis is a composer , musician and an electric guitar player .
Ziva Kunda ( June 13 , 1955 -- February 24 , 2004 ) was a social psychologist well known for her work in social cognition and motivated reasoning .
Ryu Deok - hwan ( Hangul : 류덕환 ; born June 12 , 1987 ) is a South Korean actor .
Anis Sayigh ( Arabic : أنيس صايغ‎ November 3 , 1931 - December 25 , 2009 ) was a Palestinian Arab historian .
Saad Khalloqi ( Arabic : سعد خلوقي‎ ; born May 14 , 1978 ) is a Moroccan former swimmer , who specialized in individual medley events .
Denise Nicole White , professionally known as AverySunshine ( sometimes stylized as Avery*Sunshine ) , is an American singer and pianist .
Slobodan Škerović ( born September 27 , 1954 , in Belgrade ) is a Serbian author , painter and philosopher , and a member of the international neo - avantgarde Signalism movement .
Björn Nagel ( January 25 , 1978 ) is a German - Ukrainian equestrian who competes in the sport of show jumping .
Deirdre Mullins is an Irish film , television & theatre actor , director and voice artist .
Chuck Treece ( born June 30 , 1964 ) is a session musician and professional skateboarder from Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
Edmond Stanislas Aubry ( July 29 , 1860 -- October 19 , 1936 ) was a physician , surgeon and politician in Quebec .
Laura Ann Jacobs ( born March 1 , 1960 in Baltimore ) is an American mixed media artist and sculptor .
Cyril Stein ( London , February 20 , 1928 - Jerusalem , February 15 , 2011 ) was an English bookmaker , businessman and finally philanthropic supporter of many Jewish causes and charities who first bought Ladbrokes in 1956 , then floated it in 1967 and finally left it in 1993 .
Hank Patterson ( born Elmer Calvin Patterson ; October 9 , 1888 -- August 23 , 1975 ) was an American actor and musician .
Miguel Ángel Martínez - González , MD , MPH , PhD , ( born in 1957 in Malaga , Spain ) is a Spanish physician , epidemiologist , professor , and nutrition researcher .
Richard Ambrose Reeves was an Anglican priest and opponent of Apartheid in the 20th century .
Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus , commonly referred to simply as Vegetius , was a writer of the Later Roman Empire ( late fourth century ) .
Reni Masi ( born 1933 or 1934 ) is a former Canadian politician , who served as a BC Liberal Member of the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia from 1996 to 2005 , representing the riding of Delta North .
Matthew S. Collier is a business executive , entrepreneur , speaker and politician .
Linda Lee Thomas ( November 17 , 1883 -- May 20 , 1954 ) was an American socialite and the wife of musical theatre composer Cole Porter .
Conrad Buff IV ( born July 8 , 1948 ) is an American film editor with more than 25 film credits since 1985 .
Giuseppe Torri , also known as Pippo Torri , is a Lombard far - left politician .
George Sidney Brett ( August 5 , 1879 in Briton Ferry , Wales -- October 27 , 1944 in Toronto , Canada ) was an English - Canadian psychologist .
Denton Massey ( June 20 , 1900 -- January 25 , 1984 ) was a Canadian engineer , Anglican priest and politician .
Ethel Funches was a champion amateur golfer from 1950 to 1980 who won a number of local , regional and national titles , including seven titles at the United Golfers Association National Women 's Open , fourteen wins at the Wake - Robin Golf Club Championships and over 100 local and regional titles and tropies .
Joan Kelly ( March 29 , 1928 -- August 15 , 1982 ) was a prominent American historian who wrote on the Italian Renaissance , specifically on Leon Battista Alberti .
Regy Thorpe ( born November 27 , 1971 in Auburn , New York ) was a professional lacrosse player for the Rochester Knighthawks in the National Lacrosse League who is now retired .
Burke Trieschmann is a composer and sound designer who provides music for film and video games .
Jana Salat ( born April 6 , 1979 in Košice ) is a Canadian water polo player , who was born in Slovakia .
Giulio Carmassi ( born February 21 , 1981 ) is an Italian composer , producer , video artist and multi instrumentalist .
Michael Whelan ( born June 29 , 1950 ) is an American artist of imaginative realism .
Rufat Aslanli Jabrayil oglu ( Azerbaijani : Rüfət Aslanlı Cəbrayıl oğlu ; born November 15 , 1970 ) , also spelled as Rufat Aslanly is an Azerbaijani politician who serves as the Chairman of State Committee for Securities of Azerbaijan Republic .
Blanche Edwards - Pillet ( 1858 - -1941 ) was a famous French physician , medical teacher , and leading social reformer for women .
Zhou Bichang ( simplified Chinese : 周笔畅 ; traditional Chinese : 周筆暢 ; pinyin : Zhōu Bǐchàng ) , also known as Bibi Zhou or Bibi Chow , is a Chinese singer and songwriter .

James Tomalin is a British composer and music producer .
Thomas Hal Phillips ( October 11 , 1922 -- April 3 , 2007 ) was an American actor and screenwriter .
Siliva Siliva ( born 11 February 1991 ) is an Australian rugby union player who plays for the Brumbies in Super Rugby .
Angela Elwell Hunt ( born December 20 , 1957 ) is a prolific Christian author , and her books include The Tale of Three Trees , The Debt , The Note , and The Nativity Story , among others .
Tim Easton is a Nashville , Tennessee - based American guitarist and singer - songwriter playing rock and roll , folk and Americana music .
Henry Francis Pelham , FSA , FBA ( 10 September 1846 in Berg Apton , Norfolk -- 13 February 1907 ) was an English scholar and historian .
Skottie Young ( born April 3 1978 ) is an American comic book artist , children 's book illustrator and writer .
Gesner Abelard , ( alternately Gesnerr ) ( born 22 February 1922 ) is a Haitian painter and sculptor .
Professor John Garside , CBE FREng is a British chemical engineer who was the last Vice - Chancellor of UMIST .
Kyle DeWoody is an American gallery owner and curator .
Mark Caltonhill is a British translator and writer .
According to Hasidic legend , Adam Baal Shem of Ropczyce ( Hebrew : אָדָם בַּעַל שֵׁם מרוֹפְּשִׁיץ ) was a rabbi and mystic who first introduced the movement of Hasidism .
Claude Coats ( January 17 , 1913 -- January 9 , 1992 ) was an American artist , animator and set designer , known for his work with the Walt Disney Animation Studios and Walt Disney Imagineering .
Doron Rabinovici is an Israeli - Austrian writer , historian and essayist .
Jacob Collins ( born 1964 ) is an American realist painter working in New York , NY .
Barbara Boylan ( born August 12 , 1942 in Long Beach , California ) is an American dancer and former television personality who was featured on The Lawrence Welk Show from 1961 to 1967 , and briefly for a few months in 1979 .
Ha Eun - ju ( Korean : 김 현주 ; born August 12 , 1986 ) is a South Korean swimmer , who specialized in freestyle events .
Sylvia Plimack Mangold ( born September 18 , 1938 ) is an American artist , painter , printmaker , and pastelist .
Gwilym Tew ( fl . 1460 - 1480 ) was a Welsh language poet and manuscript copyist from Tir Iarll , Glamorgan .
Matthaeus Platearius was a physician from the medical school at Salerno , and is thought to have produced a twelfth - century Latin manuscript on medicinal herbs titled `` Circa Instans '' aka ( `` The Book of Simple Medicines '' ) , later translated into French as `` Le Livre des simples medecines '' .
Siarhey Balakhonau ( or Siarhiej Bałachonaŭ ) ( bel : Сяргей Балахонаў ) ; born April 24 , 1977 ) is a Belarusian postmodern writer .
Carlos Mugica ( October 7 , 1930 - May 11 , 1974 ) was an Argentine Roman Catholic priest and activist .
Nils Håkansson ( Latinized as Nicolaus Haquini ) was a late medieval Swedish painter from Vadstena , known for his wall paintings in numerous churches in Scania , Sweden .
Dave Pomeroy ( born April 26 , 1956 ) is an American musician , known as a Nashville vocalist , songwriter , and producer ( Earwave Productions ) , but is best known as a bassist .
Jack MacKenzie ( 1892 - -1979 ) was a British - born cinematographer who worked for most of his career in the United States .
Gedaliah Alon ( Hebrew : גדליה אלון‎ ) ( 1901 - -1950 ) was a distinguished Israeli historian .
Janko Peric ( born February 24 , 1949 ) , is a former Canadian politician .
Hank Lazer ( b. San Jose , California ) is an American poet and critic who teaches at the University of Alabama .
Pusai ( ? -Good Friday , 344 ) was a Christian priest and companion in martyrdom with Simeon Barsabae and others .
Adriano Irala ( July 21 , 1894 - August 18 , 1933 ) was a Paraguayan intellectual , professor and journalist .
Edward Joseph Baines ( about 1815 - 1880 ) was an alderman and mayor of the Brisbane Municipal Council .
Massimo Dallamano ( April 17 , 1917 -- November 4 , 1976 ) , sometimes credited as Max Dillman , Max Dillmann or Jack Dalmas , was an Italian director , cinematographer and screenwriter .
Jamey Jewells ( born August 23 , 1989 ) is Canadian 1.0 point wheelchair basketball player , who has played for Team Canada and the Trier Dolphins in Germany .
John Steuart Curry ( November 14 , 1897 -- August 29 , 1946 ) was an American painter whose career spanned the years from 1924 until his death .
Andrea Weiss is an American rabbi , author , and Assistant Professor of Bible at Hebrew Union College - Jewish Institute of Religion in New York , where she was ordained in 1993 .
Michael Gartenberg is a technology journalist , analyst and blogger .
Woody Kling ( April 14 , 1925 -- April 10 , 1988 ) was an American television writer , producer , playwright , and composer .
Dan Israel is a singer - songwriter currently based in Minneapolis .
Hemant Divate is a reputed Marathi poet , editor , translator and publisher based in Mumbai .
Brigitte Peterhans ( born 1928 ) is a German American architect , born 27 August 1928 in Sulz am Neckar , Germany .
Jonas Ekfeldt is a Swedish music producer and singer .
Ines Rudolph is an East German sprint canoer who competed in the late 1980s .

Don Michael Randel ( born December 9 , 1940 ) is an American musicologist , specializing in the music of the Middle Ages and Renaissance in Spain and France .
Cyrillus , Greek jurist of the 5th century , was a professor in the ancient Law School of Berytus ( present - day Beirut ) , and one of the founders of the oecumenical school of jurists ( τῆς οἰκουμένης διδάσκαλοι ) .
Elisabeth von Janota - Bzowski ( November 23 , 1912 -- August 15 , 2012 ) was a German graphic artist known for her postage stamps and magazine designs .
James Gadsden ( May 15 , 1788 -- December 26 , 1858 ) was an American diplomat , soldier and businessman and namesake of the Gadsden Purchase , in which the United States purchased from Mexico the land that became the southern portion of Arizona and New Mexico .
Bundit Ungrangsee ( Thai : บัณฑิต อึ้งรังษี ; rtgs : Bandit Uengrangsi , born December 7 , 1970 ) is an international symphonic conductor .

Lorenzo Ochoa Salas ( died December 7 , 2009 ) was a Mexican archaeologist .
Pieter Van den Abeele is a computer programmer , and the founder of the PowerPC - version of Gentoo Linux , a foundation connected with a distribution of the Linux computer operating system .
Arpad Darazs graduated from Franz Liszt Conservatory in Budapest and was the conductor of the Hungarian State Ballet Chorus and Orchestra , as well as choirmaster for the Hungarian Radio Network .

Hattie Hart was an American Memphis blues singer and songwriter .
Ali Boulala ( born January 28 , 1979 ) is a Swedish professional skateboarder , who has appeared in the Flip Skateboards videos Sorry and Really Sorry , Osiris ' Subject to Change , and numerous Baker Skateboards videos .
Henry Flad ( July 30 , 1824 -- July 20 , 1898 ) was a German - born civil engineer who served as an engineering officer in the Union Army during the American Civil War , as a railroad engineer before and during the civil war , and later as a civil engineer after the war .
Robert Capa ( born Endre Friedmann ; October 22 , 1913 -- May 25 , 1954 ) was a Hungarian war photographer , photo journalist and also the companion and professional partner of photographer Gerda Taró .
Tony Benshoof ( born July 7 , 1975 ) is an American luger from White Bear Lake , Minnesota who has been competing since 1990 .
Maritza Medina ( born in Illinois , June 13 , 1969 ) is a Puerto Rican actress , model , doula and radio host .
Peter Corney ( born 18th century , died August 31 , 1835 ) was an English sailor and explorer .

Jean - Bernard Pommier ( born August 17 , 1944 in Beziers ) , is a French pianist and conductor .

Jack Moyles ( June 26 , 1913 -- January 16 , 1973 ) was an American actor best known for starring as cafe owner / amateur detective Rocky Jordan in the CBS radio serials A Man Named Jordan and The Adventures of Rocky Jordan .
Christopher Gore ( September 21 , 1758 -- March 1 , 1827 ) was a prominent Massachusetts lawyer , Federalist politician , and U.S. diplomat .
Coleridge - Taylor Perkinson ( June 14 , 1932 , Manhattan , New York City or possibly ( unconfirmed ) Winston - Salem , North Carolina -- March 9 , 2004 , Chicago ) was an innovative American composer whose interests spanned the worlds of jazz , dance , pop , film , television , and classical music .

Glenn Rockowitz ( born May 27 , 1970 in Plainview , New York ) , is an American writer , filmmaker , comedian and voice actor .

Pieter Bergman ( Russian : Питер Бергман ) was a Swedish - born officer of the Imperial Russian Navy in 1698 - 1706 , cartographer .
Ruby Dee ( October 27 , 1922 -- June 11 , 2014 ) was an American actress , poet , playwright , screenwriter , journalist and activist .

Roger Edward Kuntz ( January 4 , 1926 -- August 22 , 1975 ) was a highly accomplished Southern California landscape painter and a member of the Claremont Group of painters - professors and graduates of Pomona College , Scripps College , and the Claremont Graduate School .

Claudio Guastalla was an Italian opera librettist .
Givi Kandareli ( Georgian : გივი ყანდარელი ) ( February 21 , 1933 -- June 7 , 2006 ) was a famous Georgian painter , one of the premier tapestry and watercolor artists and creator of Georgian school of Gobelin Tapestry .
Colonel John R. Bourgeois was a conductor of the United States Marine Band from 1979 to 1996 , as well as esteemed composer / arranger of American music .
Ignazio Spalla ( best known as Pedro Sanchez , 1924 - -1995 ) was an Italian film actor .
Lewis Colick in an American screenwriter born in Brooklyn , New York .
Rachael Magoola is a Ugandan singer , songwriter and dancer .
Duncan Ley is an Australian playwright , actor , theatrical producer and director who has also written for Sydney 's Motion Picture Company .
Gene L. Coon ( January 7 , 1924 -- July 8 , 1973 ) was an American screenwriter and television producer .
Josip Leko ( born 19 September 1948 ) is a Croatian politician who served as a 9th Speaker of the Croatian Parliament .
Valeriy Pecheykin ( Russian : Валéрий Валéрьевич Печéйкин ) is a Russian playwright , dramaturge , and journalist .
Abolfazl Fateh is a media expert , medical doctor , journalist and political activist .
Heike Witt is a retired German swimmer who won a silver medal in the 4×100 m freestyle relay at the 1978 World Aquatics Championships .
Tania León ( born May 14 , 1943 ) is a Cuban - born composer and conductor who is also an educator and advisor to arts organizations .

Hettie Vyrine Barnhill , is a choreographer - dancer raised in St Louis , Missouri .
Chris Menges BSC , ASC ( born 15 September 1940 ) is an English cinematographer and film director .
Danie Brits was an accomplished amateur wrestler and judoka before entering professional wrestling .
Stijn Claessens ( born Constantijn Anton Marie Francois Claessens , June 19 , 1959 ) is a Dutch economist who currently serves as the Assistant Director of International Monetary Fund 's Research Department .
Ida Elionsky was a champion long distance swimmer and handicap swimmer .
Kościuszko was the youngest son of a member of the szlachta ( nobility ) , Ludwik Tadeusz Kościuszko , an officer in the Polish - Lithuanian Commonwealth Army , and his wife Tekla , née Ratomska .

Natalya Gorelova , née Zaytseva ( born 18 April 1973 in Moscow ) is a Russian middle distance runner who specialized in the 1500 metres .
Lamprus of Erythrae or Lamprus of Athens ( Ancient Greek : Λάμπρος ) was an ancient Greek musician with excellent skill at the playing of the lyre .
Ned Vaughn ( born November 20 , 1964 ) is an American film and television actor who served as vice president of the Screen Actors Guild prior to becoming the founding executive vice president of SAG - AFTRA .
John Doby Kennedy ( January 5 , 1840 -- April 14 , 1896 ) was a general in the Confederate States Army during the American Civil War , as well as a post - war planter , attorney , politician , and the 57th Lieutenant Governor of South Carolina serving under Governor Johnson Hagood .
Tamir Goodman ( born January 18 , 1982 ) , dubbed by Sports Illustrated magazine as the `` Jewish Jordan '' , is an American - born Israeli retired Orthodox Jewish basketball player .
Jay Pather is a South African curator , choreographer , and director working in Cape Town .
Steve Dille ( born March 16 , 1945 ) is a Minnesota politician and a member of the Minnesota Senate representing District 18 , which includes portions of Carver , McLeod , Meeker , Stearns and Wright counties just west of the Twin Cities metropolitan area .
Joel Ryce - Menuhin ( June 11 , 1933 -- March 31 , 1998 ) was an American pianist , who later became a Jungian psychologist in private practice .
Professor Sundaraja Sitharama Iyengar is a US - based computer scientist in the field of distributed sensor networks , computational aspects of robotics , and oceanographic applications .
Rajnesh Domalpalli is an Indian film director , from Andhra Pradesh .
Neven Maguire is an Irish celebrity chef and television personality from Blacklion , County Cavan , Ireland .
Wanda Perry - Josephs is a gospel music singer - songwriter and minister from Boston , Massachusetts .
Otto von Guericke ( originally spelled Gericke , German pronunciation : ( ˈɡeːʁɪkə ) ) ( November 20 , 1602 -- May 11 , 1686 ( Julian calendar ) ; November 30 , 1602 -- May 21 , 1686 ( Gregorian calendar ) ) was a German scientist , inventor , and politician .
Rudolf Rittner ( June 30 , 1869 -- February 4 , 1943 ) was a German actor born in Weissbach , Moravia , famous for playing knight and folk hero Florian Geyer in Gerhart Hauptmann 's drama of the same name .
Carson Charles is a Trinidad and Tobago politician and former Minister of Works and Transportation .
Erica Buettner is an American indie folk singer songwriter based in Lisboa , Portugal .
Steven Karidoyanes ( born November 5 , 1957 , Boston , Massachusetts to Michael and Tula Karidoyanes ) is an American composer , broadcaster and conductor with the Plymouth Philharmonic Orchestra .
Bernie Finkelstein ( born August 12 , 1944 ) is a Canadian music executive and talent manager .
Jovan Subotić ( 1817 - -1886 ) was a lawyer , writer and politician who was member of the Serbian Royal Academy of Sciences and Serbian Learned Society .
David Guterson ( /ˈɡʌtərsən/ GUT - ər - sən ; born May 4 , 1956 ) is an American novelist , short story writer , poet , journalist , and essayist .
Li Mei - shu ( Chinese : 李梅樹 ; pinyin : Li Méishù ) ( March 13 , 1902 - February 6 , 1983 ) was a Taiwanese painter , sculptor , and councillor .
Tom Greenway ( June 5 , 1909 - -February 8 , 1985 ) was an American character actor of film and television , whose career , in movies and television westerns , extended from 1949 to 1965 .
Alex Biryukov is a cryptographer , currently a full professor at the University of Luxembourg .
On July 3 , 1994 , Bijan Mortazavi performed his music with an orchestra at the Greek Theatre in Los Angeles , becoming the first Iranian musician to be featured at the theatre .
Liv Maessen is an Australian pop singer who had hits in the early 1970s with `` The Love Moth '' , `` Knock , Knock Who 's There ? '' and `` Snowbird '' .
Peter Britt is still known and celebrated in Southern Oregon as the pioneer photographer who left a rich heritage of local 19th - century portraits and landscapes .
Brijesh Kumar Gupta ( Nepali : बृजेश कुमार गुप्ता ) is a Nepalese politician , belonging to the Tarai Madhes Loktantrik Party .
Anna Lubiw is a computer scientist known for her work in computational geometry and graph theory .
Carlo Labruzzo born in Rome , was an Italian painter , mainly of landscapes .
Nicos Nicolaides ( Greek : Νίκος Νικολαΐδης ) was a Greek painter and writer .

Victor Morin ( August 15 , 1865 -- September 30 , 1960 ) was a Canadian notary , politician , and writer .
Vyacheslav Ivanovich Lebedev ( Russian : Вячеслав Иванович Лебедев ) ( January 27 , 1930 -- March 22 , 2010 ) was a Soviet and Russian mathematician , known for his work on numerical analysis .
Ignatz Anton Pilát ( 1820 - -1870 ) was an Austrian - born gardener who migrated to the United States to work on the design and planting of New York 's Central Park .
Sheree Bradford - Lea is a Canadian freelance cartoonist and mixed - media artist , based in Ottawa , Ontario .
Vincent Triest ( Albanian pronunciation : ( vinsɛnt trɪst ) Dutch pronunciation : ( vɪncɛnt trɪɛst ) ) is a Dutch - Albanian journalist .
Kathleen Madigan ( born September 30 , 1965 ) is an American comedian and TV personality .
William Bonnar ( 1800 - 1853 ) was a Scottish painter of portraits , history , and genre in the 19th century .
Song Lun ( Chinese : 宋伦 , born January 18 , 1981 in Qiqihar ) is a Chinese figure skater .
George Michael Cohan ( July 3 , 1878 -- November 5 , 1942 ) , known professionally as George M. Cohan , was an American entertainer , playwright , composer , lyricist , actor , singer , dancer and producer .
Andrée Ruffo is a former Quebec judge named to the Bench in 1987 .
Lois Johnson Scoggins ( May 15 , 1942 -- July 7 , 2014 ) professionally known as Lois Johnson was an American country music singer .
Yasser Salihee ( 1974 - -2005 ) was an Iraqi doctor and journalist from Baghdad .
Jeff Kurtenacker ( born September 7 , 1976 ) is a music composer for video games , television , radio , and film .
Waldy Dzikowski ( ˈvaldi d͡ʑiˈkɔvskʲi ) ( born July 23 , 1959 in Wschowa ) is a Polish politician .
Michael Sterling Eaton is an American multi media artist .
Mahmoud al - Rimawy ( Arabic : محمود الريماوي ) ( born 1948 ) is a Palestinian journalist and author .
Zhao Kezhi ( Chinese : 赵克志 ; born December 1953 ) is a Chinese politician , serving since 2015 as the Communist Party Secretary of Hebei province .
Roger N. Beachy ( born 1944 ) is an American biologist and the founding president of the Donald Danforth Plant Science Center in St. Louis , Missouri .
Stuart Pyke is a British - born sports journalist and broadcaster .
Joseph N. Langan was a Mobile , Alabama - area community leader and politician who served four terms on the Mobile City Commission as well as several terms as Mayor of Mobile .
Archidike ( also transliterated Archidice , Greek : αρχιδικη ) was a celebrated hetaera of Naucratis in Egypt .
Edward Chiera ( August 5 , 1885 - June 20 , 1933 ) was an Italian - American archaeologist , Assyriologist , and scholar of religions and linguistics .
Gene October is an English musician , best known as the singer for the punk rock band , Chelsea .
Padma Ratna Tuladhar ( Nepali : पद्मरत्न तुलाधर ) is a former Nepalese politician and currently a human rights activist .
Dámaso Pérez Prado ( Spanish pronunciation : ( ˈpeɾes ˈpɾaðo ) ; December 11 , 1916 -- September 14 , 1989 ) was a Cuban - Mexican bandleader , singer , organist , pianist and composer , who also made brief appearances in films .
Jerard Hurwitz ( born 1928 ) is an American biochemist who co - discovered RNA polymerase in 1960 along with Sam Weiss , Audrey Stevens , and James Bonner .
Nathan Rogers ( born July 16 , 1979 in Hamilton , Ontario ) is a Canadian folk musician / songwriter .
Lidia Nencheva ( Bulgarian : Лидия Ненчева , born in Plovdiv ) is a Bulgarian sport shooter .
Tory Mason ( also known as Adrian ) is an American pornographic actor ( porn star ) who has appeared in gay pornography ; both in pornographic films and online at commercial amateur porn websites .
Jeff Wellemeyer ( born September 13 , 1972 ) is an American entrepreneur , software developer and an international property and resort developer .
Osman Şirin ( born on November 5 , 1943 in Vakfıkebir , Trabzon Province ) , is a high - ranked Turkish judge and currently the Deputy First President of the Court of Cassation .
Francis L. Kellogg ( January 5 , 1917 - -April 6 , 2006 ) was a diplomat , a special assistant to the Secretary of State during the Nixon and Ford Administrations and a prominent socialite in New York City .
Craig Dias is a current Gaelic football player with Kilmacud Crokes and Dublin .
Alyssa Graham ( born Alyssa Hope Altschul ) is a singer - songwriter based largely in New York City .
Audrey B. Collins ( born 1945 ) is a former United States district judge and an associate justice of the Second District Court of Appeal for the State of California .
Philip Gyselaer , also Giselaer ( c. 1620 -- after 1650 ) , was a Flemish painter specialized in history painting in the tradition of Willem van Herp .
Ricardo LaMarre , better known as his stage name Rico Beats , is an American record producer and songwriter from Brooklyn , New York City .
Manijeh Hekmat ( Persian : منیژه حکمت ) is an Iranian film director .
Bobo Jenkins ( January 7 , 1916 -- August 14 , 1984 ) was an American Detroit blues and electric blues guitarist , singer and songwriter .
Richard Angst ( 1905 - -1984 ) was a Swiss cinematographer who worked on more than ninety films during his career , most of them in Germany .
Charles E. Sporck ( born November 15 , 1927 ) is an American engineer and former company manager .
Shlomo Grofman is a leading Israeli real estate developer businessperson .
Ryan Odom ( born July 11 , 1974 ) is an American men 's college basketball coach who is currently the head coach of the Lenoir - Rhyne Bears , a position he has held since May 2015 .
Patrick Krief is a Canadian musician and singer - songwriter .
Charles Edward Moss ( February 7 , 1870 Hyde , Cheshire - November 11 , 1930 Johannesburg ) , was an English - born South African botanist , the youngest son of a nonconformist minister , and is noted for being the editor of the first two parts of The Cambridge British Flora published in 1914 and 1920 .
Ricardo de Jaxa Malachowski ( Polish : Ryszard Jaxa - Małachowski Kulisicz ) was a Peruvian architect of Polish and Slovak origin .
Ahmad Monshi Ghomi , also known as Ghazi Ahmad , was a Persian author and calligrapher .
April Lee is an artist whose work has appeared in role - playing games , Collectible card games , and PC games .
Roman Aramian is an Armenian boxer , fighting out of Germany .
Hardy Rawls ( born November 18 , 1952 ) is an American character actor .
Wade Bowen is an American Texas Country / Red Dirt singer from Waco , Texas .
Sam Lavagnino ( born June 29 , 2006 ) is an American child voice actor known for the role of Catbug in Bravest Warriors .
Ron O'Neal ( September 1 , 1937 -- January 14 , 2004 ) was an American actor , director and screenwriter , who rose to fame in his role as Youngblood Priest , a New York cocaine dealer in the blaxploitation film Super Fly ( 1972 ) and its sequel Super Fly T.N.T. ( 1973 ) .
Dihan Slabbert ( born 3 June 1982 ) , is a South African singer , performer , composer , producer , musician , and songwriter .
Jim Kirkpatrick is a Unionist politician who has represented the Ulster Unionist Party ( UUP ) three times and the Democratic Unionist Party twice .
Ronald Siler Jr. , commonly known as Ron Siler ( born April 8 , 1980 in Knoxville ) is a US - American amateur boxer who has competed for the US at the 2004 Olympics .
George W. Cross ( born September 30 , 1872 ) was an American politician from Cape Girardeau County , Missouri , who served in the Missouri House of Representatives .
Tom Allom is an English sound engineer and record producer , mainly active in the 1970s and 1980s .
Douglas Turner Ward ( May 5 , 1930 ) is an American playwright , actor , director and theatrical producer best known as a founder and artistic director of the Negro Ensemble Company ( NEC ) .
Cynthia Cristina Ferrare ( born February 18 , 1950 ) is an American former fashion model , actress , author and television talk - show host .
Birgir Örn Birgisson is an Icelandic basketball coach and a former professional player who played 26 games for the Icelandic National Team .
Phil Alden Robinson ( born March 1 , 1950 ) is an American film director and screenwriter whose films include Field of Dreams , Sneakers , and The Sum of All Fears .
Shahar Tzuberi ( Hebrew : שחר צוברי‎ ) ( born September 1 , 1986 ) is an Israeli windsurfer and Olympic bronze medalist , surfing in the `` Neil Pryde '' RS :
John J. Considine III ( born July 18 , 1948 ) is an American former politician and attorney .
Paris Wells is an Australian singer songwriter based in Melbourne .
Oliver Crawford ( August 12 , 1917 -- September 24 , 2008 ) was an American screenwriter and author who overcame the Hollywood blacklist during the McCarthy Era of the 1950s to become one of the entertainment industry 's most successful television writers .
George Wallace Gouinlock ( August 1 , 1861- February 13 , 1932 ) was a Toronto - based architect who was responsible for notable structures in Toronto .
Ubaldo Buttafava ( died May 9 , 2007 ) was an Italian communist marxist- leninist politician .
Monica McInerney is a best - selling Australian - born , Dublin - based writer .
Kristina Olsen ( born May 26 , 1957 , San Francisco , California ) is an American contemporary folk singer - songwriter and multi - instrumentalist known for her sometimes humorous , heartfelt and sometimes ribald songs .
Jack Thomas Brinkley ( born December 22 , 1930 ) is an American politician , educator and lawyer .
Johnny Hazzard ( born Frankie Valenti on September 21 , 1977 ) is a former American pornographic actor , model , and recording artist who performs in gay and bisexual pornographic films for a number of studios , mainly Rascal Video , and has appeared in mainstream film and television productions under his own name .
On January 2 , 1996 , Steady B , along with C.E.B. band mate Cool C , and another local Philadelphia rapper , Mark Canty , attempted a bank robbery at a PNC bank branch in Feltonville .
Jonathan Sweet is an Australian actor best known as a character actor and for his supporting roles .
María Fernanda Espinosa Garcés ( born September 7 , 1964 ) is an Ecuadorian politician and diplomat .
Conrad Yama born Kiyoshi Conrad Hamanaka , ( October 8 , 1919 - March 10 , 2010 ) , was an Asian American theatre , film and television actor .
Nurettin Sözen ( born 1937 in Gürün ) is a Turkish doctor , politician and the former mayor of Istanbul , Turkey .
DJ Clay ( born Michael Velasquez ) is an American record producer , rapper and disc jockey from Detroit , Michigan .
Heinrich Brandler ( 1881 - -1967 ) was a German communist trade unionist , politician , revolutionary activist , and writer .
Vera Chok is a London - based actor and writer , who has featured in stage , screen and radio roles .
Terry Rodgers ( born September 11 , 1947 ) is an American artist known for his large scale canvases that focus on portraying contemporary body politics .
Stevanne Auerbach ( born September 22 , 1938 ) also known as Dr. Toy , is an American educator , child development expert , writer and toyologist .
Marie Corridon Mortell ( February 5 , 1930 -- May 26 , 2010 ) , née Marie Louise Corridon , was an American competition swimmer and Olympic champion .
Arnold Schulman ( born August 11 , 1925 ) is an American playwright , screenwriter , producer , a songwriter and novelist .
Herbert Pugh ( fl . 1758 - -1788 ) was an Irish landscape - painter .
William G. Greene , Jr. ( born April 24 , 1940 in Stoneham , Massachusetts ) is an American politician was as a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives from 1993 to 2011 , a Billerica , Massachusetts town meeting member from 1970 to 1992 , and Billerica Town Moderator from 1985 to 1992 .
Manuel Lopes Rodrigues ( December 31 , 1860 -- October 22 , 1917 ) was a Brazilian Realist painter .
Marika Moisseeff is a French social anthropologist and psychiatrist .
Ríkarður Ríkarðsson ( born November 2 , 1977 ) is an Icelandic former swimmer , who specialized in sprint freestyle and butterfly events .
Brian Laumatia is a former rugby league player who played for the Cronulla Sharks in the Super League .
Aristolaos ( Greek : Ἀριστόλαος , 350 ? BC ) was a Greek painter of high caliber who lived in Sicyon , and who was the son and pupil of the painter Pausias .
Sana Hassainia ( born November 1 , 1974 ) is a Tunisian born Canadian politician .
Charles Cyphers ( born July 28 , 1939 ) is an American actor who has starred in many films and on television .
Roger Greenspun is an American journalist and noted film critic .
Boyce Brown ( April 16 , 1910 -- January 30 , 1959 ) was an American jazz dixieland alto saxophonist born in Chicago , Illinois .
Howard Estabrook ( July 11 , 1884 -- July 16 , 1978 ) was an American actor , film director and producer , and screenwriter .
Roxann Dawson ( née Caballero , also credited as Roxann Biggs and Roxann Biggs - Dawson ) is an American actress , producer , and director , best known as B'Elanna Torres on the television series Star Trek :
Tasneem Khalil is an exiled Bangladeshi journalist who previously worked for The Daily Star and was a stringer for CNN and a consultant for Human Rights Watch .
Jan Stallich ( 1907 - 1973 ) was a Czech cinematographer who worked in several European film industries including Britain , France and Italy as well as in his native country .
Worthington Miner ( November 13 , 1900 -- December 11 , 1982 ) was an American film producer , screenwriter , actor and director .
Chiang Pin - kung ( Chinese : 江丙坤 ; pinyin : Jiāng Bǐngkūn ) ( born December 16 , 1932 ) is a Taiwanese politician .
Chick Vennera ( born March 27 , 1947 ) is an American actor known for his role as Joe Mondragon , in Robert Redford 's The Milagro Beanfield War , among other movies .
Dan Ioan Popescu ( Romanian pronunciation : ( ˈdan iˈo̯an poˈpesku ) ; born March 10 , 1948 -- Ploieşti ) is a Romanian businessman and politician .
José Capmany was a Costa Rican songwriter and guitarist .
Teju Cole ( born June 27 , 1975 ) is a Nigerian - American writer , photographer , and art historian .
William Ashton Switzer , known as Bill Switzer ( born March 28 , 1984 ) , is a Canadian actor .
Joel Augustus Rogers ( September 6 , 1880 or 1883 -- March 26 , 1966 ) was a Jamaican - American author , journalist , and historian who contributed to the history of Africa and the African diaspora , especially the history of African Americans in the United States .
George Hara Williams ( November 17 , 1894 - -September 12 , 1945 ) was a farmer activist and politician .
Fred Lukoff ( Korean : 프레드 루코프 ) ( November 12 , 1920 -- August 13 , 2000 ) was an American linguist who specialized in the study of the Korean language and was the first president of the International Association for Korean Language Education ( IAKLE ) .
Everett Shinn ( November 6 , 1876 -- May 1 , 1953 ) was an American realist painter and member of the Ashcan School .
Lawton Williams ( July 24 , 1922 , Troy , Tennessee -- July 27 , 2007 , Fort Worth , Texas ) was an American country music singer and songwriter .
Tristan Clopet ( /kloʊˈpeɪ/ ; born October 8 , 1986 ) is an American singer , songwriter and composer .

Eoin Brosnan is an Irish Gaelic football player who plays at centre forward .
Mary Zophres ( born March 23 , 1964 as Maria Zafeiropoulou ) is an American costume designer who has worked in the film industry since 1989 .
Kate Wolf ( born Kathryn Louise Allen , January 27 , 1942 -- December 10 , 1986 ) was an American folk singer and songwriter .
Nikodem Sulik - Sarnowski , who used the noms de guerre `` Jodko '' , `` Jod '' , `` Karol '' , and `` Sarnowski '' ( August 15 , 1893 - January 14 , 1954 ) , was an officer of the Russian Imperial Army , and Generał brygady of the Polish Army .
R. Ajay was an Indian film actor who had appeared in Tamil films .
Alisher Mirzo ( born March 21 , 1948 Tashkent , Uzbekistan ) is an Uzbek painter whose works are kept in galleries , museums and private collections in Germany , France , Italy , Spain , Norway , Luxembourg , Bulgaria , Yugoslavia , Russia , Japan , India , Madagascar and the United States of America .
Ivan Čargo ( February 25 , 1898 -- August 11 , 1958 ) was a Slovene painter , illustrator , scenographer , and caricaturist .
Leslie R. Lemon ( born January 19 , 1947 ) is an American meteorologist bridging research and forecasting with expertise in weather radar , particular regarding severe convective storms .
Arthur Hendrix ( born October 7 , 1912 in Birmingham , Alabama - April 22 , 1988 in Lakeland , Florida ) was an American amateur tennis player in the 1930s .
Mulazim Hussain ( Urdu : ملازم حسین‎ ) is a Pakistani singer , songwriter and music producer from Rawalpindi who is signed to Coke Studio .
Sir Pheroze Sethna was an Indian politician .
Paresh Lamba ( born June 26 , 1966 in Mumbai , Maharashtra ) is an Indian fashion designer and business executive , best known for his clothing company , Paresh Lamba Signatures , which is a multi - national company .
Sergio González Rodríguez ( b. January 26 , 1950 ) is a Mexican journalist and writer who is best known for his writings on the femicides in Ciudad Juárez in the 1990s to 2000s .
Eric Poisson is a Canadian , award winning physicist specializing in the theory of black holes .
Jennie Lee Riddle ( born April 22 , 1967 ) is an American Christian songwriter , best known for penning `` Revelation Song '' , first made popular by Kari Jobe and carried to # 1 by Phillips , Craig & Dean .
Arthur Mercante Sr . ( January 26 , 1920 -- April 10 , 2010 ) was an international boxing referee .
Oddvar Brå ( born March 16 , 1951 ) is a Norwegian former cross - country skier .
Robert Gothie ( October 2 , 1929 -- June 18 , 1993 ) was an American actor who appeared on television , in the movies and on Broadway in the 1950s and 1960s .
Abyale is a Franco - African dance music singer who had success in the 1990s .
Félix Desplan ( born February 22 , 1943 in Guadeloupe ) is a French politician who was elected to the French Senate on September 25 , 2011 representing the department of Guadeloupe .
Al Sapienza ( born July 31 , 1962 ) is an American actor , who has had numerous roles in television , stage and film productions .
Idola Saint - Jean ( May 19 , 1880 -- April 6 , 1945 ) was a Quebec journalist , educator and feminist .
( Helen ) Diane Glancy is an American poet , author and playwright of Cherokee descent .
Camillo De Lellis ( born June 11 , 1976 ) is an Italian mathematician who is active in the fields of calculus of variations , hyperbolic systems of conservation laws , geometric measure theory and fluid dynamics .
Louis Dicken Wilson ( May 12 , 1789 - August 12 , 1847 ) was a North Carolinian politician and general in the United States Army .
José Antonio Bottiroli ( January 1 , 1920 -- March 15 , 1990 ) was an Argentine classical music composer and poet .
Jozef Lupták ( born 1969 , December 30,Slovakia ) is a Slovak cellist and artistic director .
Hashim Djojohadikusumo is an Indonesian entrepreneur .
Stephen Partridge ( born 1953 ) is an English video artist who studied under David Hall and his career as an artist , academic and researcher , helped to establish video as an art form in the UK .
Codrin Țapu ( born December 17 , 1973 ) is a Romanian author and psychologist who has written about the aspects or `` hypostases '' of personality .
Martin Sorrondeguy is the singer of hardcore bands Los Crudos and Limp Wrist , the founder of the DIY record label , Lengua Armada Discos , documentary film director and a prominent figure in both the straight edge scene and the queercore scene .
José Antonio Rivera ( December 5 , 1963 in Río Piedras , Puerto Rico-- April 4 , 2005 ) was a Puerto Rican boxer .
Henry Schell Hagert ( May 2 , 1826 -- December 18 , 1885 ) was a United States lawyer , writer , and poet .
Stuart MacBride is a Scottish writer , most famous for his crime thrillers set in the `` Granite City '' of Aberdeen and featuring Detective Sergeant Logan McRae .
Floyd H. Crain ( born June 3 , 1929 ) , was an American politician in the state of Tennessee .
Kevin L. Finnegan ( born June 1 , 1964 in Newburyport , Massachusetts ) an American politician and the current Clerk for the Peabody District Court in Peabody , Massachusetts .
Ozzie Wright is an Australian professional born 07/01/1976 surfer , artist , filmmaker and musician , known for his surfing innovation and punk rock style .
Cheryl Overs is a researcher and human rights activist from Melbourne , Australia .
Zacarías Reyán ( born May 10 , 1948 ) , is the pseudonym of Reinaldo Antonio Plazas Peralta , also known as Z. Reyán , a Colombian writer , author of novels , poems and epics in Spanish language .
Helen Boulding is a London - based singer - songwriter originally from Sheffield , South Yorkshire , UK .
Neil Nathan is an American rock / folk / alt country singer songwriter from New York City .
Harold Rudolf Foster ( August 16 , 1892 -- July 25 , 1982 ) , better known as Hal Foster , was a Canadian - American comic book artist and writer best known as the creator of the comic strip Prince Valiant .
William Edward Childs ( born March 8 , 1957 ) , best known as Billy Childs , is a composer and jazz pianist from Los Angeles .
Levon Chookaszian ( Armenian : Լևոն Բաբկենի Չուգասզյան , born April 9 , 1952 ) is an Armenian art historian and the UNESCO Chair of Armenian Art History ( UNESCO CAAH ) .
Frank Resetarits is a lacrosse player from Hamburg , New York .
Molly Louise Shepard is a published dramatic author , Off - Off - Broadway playwright , and produced screenwriter .
Kevin Mark Murphy ( born May 24 , 1957 in Toronto , Ontario ) is a Canadian musician and criminal lawyer , best known as a co - founder of the Ottawa - based music group , Singing Fools .
Lonette McKee ( born July 22 , 1954 ) is an American film , television and theater actress , music composer , producer , songwriter , screenwriter and director .
Shelley Tanaka is a Canadian editor of numerous young adult novels , an award - winning author of non - fiction for children , a translator , and a writing teacher .
Brinda Sarathy is a Tamil film director , screenwriter and dialogue writer .
Morgan Finlay is a Canadian singer - songwriter from North Vancouver , British Columbia , and based for much of his career in Toronto .
Antoni Wiwulski or Antanas Vivulskis ( 1877 - -1919 ) was a Polish - Lithuanian architect and sculptor .
Erislandy Savón Cotilla ( born July 21 , 1990 ) is a Cuban amateur super heavyweight boxer .

Melina Paez is a Los Angeles - based film , commercial and stage actor .
T. J. Cook ( born September 8 , 1982 ) is an American mixed martial artist and former professional boxer who last competed in Strikeforce 's Light Heavyweight division .
Roy Halee is an American record producer and engineer , best known for working with Simon and Garfunkel .
Chuck Niles ( aka `` Bebop Charlie '' ) ( born Charles Neidel ; June 24 , 1927 - March 15 , 2004 ) was a well - known jazz disc jockey who became the only jazz DJ to be on the Hollywood Walk of Fame .
Ray Bloom ( born George Raymond Bloom , 13 September 1941 , Aston , Sheffield , Yorkshire , England ) was an English first - class cricketer , who played one match for Yorkshire in 1964 .

Myrta Silva ( September 11 , 1927 -- December 2 , 1987 ) was a Puerto Rican singer , composer and television producer who was known affectionately as `` La Gorda De Oro '' .
Brad Cross is an Australian rugby league player who played 3 matches for the Canberra Raiders in the 2007 season of National Rugby League .
Steve Fisk is a Washington - based audio engineer , record producer and musician .
Enrique Bernales Ballesteros ( born November 6 , 1940 , Lima ) is a Peruvian scholar and politician .
Hal Wissel ( born February 8 , 1939 ) is an American basketball coach who has worked at the professional and collegiate level in his career .
Preeti Sagar is a former Bollywood playback singer who won the Filmfare Award for Best Female Playback Singer for the song `` Mero Gaam Katha Parey '' from Manthan in 1978 and was previously nominated for the hit song `` My Heart is Beating '' from Julie ( 1975 ) .
Mariana Constantin ( b. August 3 , 1960 ) is a retired Romanian artistic gymnast .

Joeli Nabuka is a former Fijian politician , who served in the House of Representatives from 2002 to 2006 .

Caterina Benedicta Grazianini ( fl . early 18th century ) was an Italian composer of oratorios in Vienna .
Lester McCumbers ( August 15 , 1921 - January 26 , 2015 ) was an American old - time fiddler from Nicut , West Virginia .
James Rupert Miller ( June 27 , 1869 -- August 23 , 1946 ) was an architect active in San Francisco , California in the first half of the 20th century .
Eric Pehota ( born November 17 , 1964 ) is a Canadian alpine skier , best known for his more than 40 first descents of mountains on skis , and his appearances in a number of ski films , including ski documentary Steep ( 2007 ) , and a number of Warren Miller films .
Lathika ( Malayalam : ലതിക ) is an Indian playback singer whose voice held sway over the music charts in the late 1980s - early 1990s in the Malayalam film industry .
T. M. McNally is an American novelist , and short story writer .
Gottlieb Fluhmann ( c. 1837 - c. 1892 ) was a reclusive cattle rancher in Park County , Colorado , whose mysterious disappearance was not resolved until 1944 .

Steven Doane ( born December 10 , 1950 ) is an American cellist and recitalist .

Scott Eastwood ( born Scott Clinton Reeves ; March 21 , 1986 ) is an American actor and model .
Avi Issacharoff is an Israeli journalist known for his focus on Palestinian affairs .
Paul Ekman ( born February 15 , 1934 ) is an American psychologist who is a pioneer in the study of emotions and their relation to facial expressions .

Marc Zender is an anthropologist , epigrapher , and linguist noted for his work on Maya hieroglyphic writing .

Rhys Parry Jones is a Welsh actor best known for his role in the S4C children 's series Plismon Puw .
Taran Davies is a film producer and director best known for his documentary film Afghan Stories ( 2002 ) , and the IMAX feature documentary Journey to Mecca ( 2009 ) .
Roshan Thapa ( Nepali : रोशन थापा ; born July 24 , 1983 ) is singer , director ( composer ) in the Nepali music industry .
