Maureen Feeney is an American politician who is the current City Clerk of Boston , Massachusetts .
Vivian Schilling ( born 1968 ) is an American novelist , screenwriter , actress and independent filmmaker .
Anthony O'Sullivan ( date of birth unknown -- July 5 , 1920 ) was an American silent film actor and director .
Thwaiba Kanafani is Canadian / Syrian engineer whose 2012 decision to volunteer to fight with Syrian rebels against the Bashar al Assad regime triggered world - wide coverage .
Diodorus Cronus ( Greek : Διόδωρος Κρόνος ; died c. 284 BCE ) was a Greek philosopher and dialectician connected to the Megarian school .
Beno Gutenberg ( June 4 , 1889 -- January 25 , 1960 ) was a German - American seismologist who made several important contributions to the science .
Gerry Lopez ( born November 7 , 1948 ) , aka Mr. Pipeline , is an American surfer , shaper , journalist , and film actor .
Adam Larter is a British alternative comedian and founder of Weirdos Comedy Club .
Jake Clemons ( born February 27 , 1980 ) is a singer - songwriter , an American musician and since 2012 is best known for being the saxophonist for Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band .
Aharon Keshales ( Hebrew : אהרון קשלס ) ( born April 16 , 1976 ) is an Israeli film director , screenwriter and film critic .
Benny Andrews ( November 13 , 1930 -- November 10 , 2006 ) was an American painter , printmaker , creator of collages and educator .
José María Bacchelli Ortega ( born 1952 in Barcelona ) , known professionally as Bacchelli , is a Spanish singer who is best known for his participation in the 1981 Eurovision Song Contest .
Carl Krauch ( April 7 , 1887 -- February 3 , 1968 ) was a German chemist , industrialist and Nazi war criminal .
Cole Taylor was a pornographic actor who primarily worked in gay adult film in the 1980s .
Nathan George is an African - American supporting actor who was active from 1971 - 97 .
Victor Lundin ( June 15 , 1930 - June 29 , 2013 ) was an American character actor who often billed himself as the first Klingon on the original Star Trek .
Grace Nickel , R.C.A. is a Canadian ceramic artist and art instructor in post - secondary education .
Glenn Albert Black was an influential archaeologist of the United States who was among the first professionals to study Indiana prehistoric sites .
Diogo Veloso was an explorer from Portugal who , along with Blas Ruiz , was the first Europeans to ever set foot in Laos .
Emil Norlander ( 1865 - 1935 ) was a Swedish journalist , author , songwriter and producer of musical revues .
Pauline Ducruet is a competitive diver .
Lucile Saunders McDonald ( September 1 , 1898 - June 23 , 1992 ) was a Pacific Northwest journalist , historian and author of children 's books .
Caucher Birkar ( Kurdish : کۆچەر بیرکار ) is a Kurdish mathematician who is currently engaged in research and teaching at the University of Cambridge .
John Sturt ( 1658 - -1730 ) was an English engraver , apprenticed to Robert White .
Anders Grillhammar ( born September 7 , 1964 ) is a former Swedish freestyle swimmer .
Charles DeWitt Watts ( September 21 , 1917 -- July 12 , 2004 ) was an African American surgeon and activist for the poor .
Yuri Rozum ( b. 1954 , Moscow , USSR ) is a Russian - born concert pianist and philanthropist .
Ulrik Cappelen ( né Christensen ) ( born March 28 , 1964 ) , known as Ulrik Moseby , is a Danish former association football player in the midfielder position .
Rudolf Aebersold ( better known as Ruedi Aebersold born September 12 , 1954 ) is a Swiss biologist , regarded as a pioneer in the fields of proteomics and systems biology .
Raúl Astor ( January 10 , 1925 -- June 22 , 1995 ) born Raúl Ignacio Spangenberg Parera was a Argentinean - born Mexican actor , director , producer and announcer .
Dalton Davis is a South African rugby union player , currently playing with Eastern Province Grand Challenge club side Despatch .
Ricardo Colombi ( born August 30 , 1957 ) is an Argentine lawyer and politician elected Governor of Corrientes Province in 2009 .
Alison Lee ( born February 26 , 1995 ) is an American professional golfer who plays on the LPGA Tour and is a college student at the University of California , Los Angeles .
Professor Gerd Jürgens ( also spelt Juergens ) ( born 1949 ) is a plant developmental biologist currently(as of end 2010 ) holding the posts of Director of the Cell Biology Department at the Max Planck Institute for Developmental Biology and Head of the Center for Plant Molecular Biology(ZMBP ) at the Eberhard - Karls Universität Tübingen .
Alia Muhammad Baker ( also spelled `` Baqer '' ) was the chief librarian in the Al Basrah Central Library , Basra , Iraq .
Hayley Kiyoko Alcroft ( /ˈheɪli kiˈjoʊkoʊ ˈælkrɒft/ HAY - lee kee - YOHK - oh AL - kroft ; born April 3 , 1991 ) , known professionally as Hayley Kiyoko , is a Japanese - American actress , singer and songwriter .
Barbara Roy was born in Kinston , North Carolina and is a dance music singer .
Dudu Tucci ( full name : Eduardo Tucci da Silva ; born May 5 , 1955 in São Paulo ) is a Brazilian percussionist , singer and composer .
Esdras Minville ( November 7 , 1896 in Grande - Vallée -- December 9 , 1975 ) was a Quebec writer , economist and sociologist .
John Warwick Montgomery is a noted lawyer , professor , Lutheran theologian , and prolific author living in France .
L. Paige Marvel ( born December 6 , 1949 ) is an Article I federal judge for the United States Tax Court .
Vicente Leñero Otero ( June 9 , 1933 -- December 3 , 2014 ) was a Mexican novelist , journalist , and playwright .
George Antheil ( /ˈæntaɪl/ ; July 8 , 1900 -- February 12 , 1959 ) was an American avant - garde composer , pianist , author and inventor whose modernist musical compositions explored the modern sounds -- musical , industrial , mechanical -- of the early 20th century .
Toni Harper ( born June 8 , 1937 ) ( aka Toni Dunlap ) is a former child singer , who retired from performing at the age of 29 .
Egan Inoue is an American Brazilian Jiu - Jitsu practitioner , mixed martial artist and racquetball player .
Antonio Ledesma Jayme ( July 24 , 1854 - October 19 , 1937 ) was a Filipino lawyer , revolutionary , Governor of Negros Occidental , and assemblyman , as well as a lawmaker and a revolutionary nation 's founding fatherand a signatory to a state 's constitution .
Coja Petrus Uscan ( b. 1680/81 -- d.1751 ) was an Armenian merchant and leader of the Armenian community of Madras who was known for his immense wealth and unflinching devotion and loyalty to the British during the French occupation of Madras .
Connie Champagne , née Kelly Kay Brock , born November 23 , 1959 is an American singer , song - writer and actor .
Tawatha Agee is an American background singer and song - writer .
Frankie Callahan was an American boxer ( real name : Samuel Holtzman ) born on February 10 , 1895 in Brooklyn , New York .
Tim Vega ( born Timothy Martin Vega ; September 14 , 1965 -- died April 29 , 2002 ) was an American graphic designer best known for his work with several musical acts , especially jam bands .
Aldo Eminente ( born August 19 , 1931 ) is a French swimmer and olympic medalist .
Sanford Ross ( January 25 , 1907 -- March 1 , 1954 ) was an American realist painter and printmaker .
Paul Le Mat ( born September 22 , 1945 ) is an American actor who first came to prominence in the 1973 film American Graffiti , for which he won the Golden Globe Award for New Star Of The Year - Actor .
Joe Abercrombie ( born 31 December 1974 ) is a British fantasy writer and film editor .
Michael Torke ( /ˈtɔːrki/ ; born September 22 , 1961 ) is an American composer who writes music influenced by jazz and minimalism .
Lane DeGregory is an American journalist who works for the Tampa Bay Times--
André de Quadros ( 1953 - - ) , conductor , ethnomusicologist , music educator , and human rights activist has conducted and undertaken research in over forty countries and is a professor of music at Boston University .
Lisbeth Korsmo ( born 14 January 1948 ) is a Norwegian former speed skater , cyclist and Olympic medalist .
Rob Simonsen ( born March 11 , 1978 ) is an American film composer located in Los Angeles .
Seiichi Ikehata ( Japanese : 池端清一 ) ( August 20 , 1929 - February 28 , 2007 ) was a Japanese politician .
Carleton Watkins ( 1829 - 1916 ) was an American photographer of the 19th century .
Kurt Markus , self - taught American photographer , was born in rural Montana .
Laurence Cottle is a Welsh electric bass guitarist and composer .
Joseph Jomo Pierre , also credited as Joseph Pierre , is a Trinidadian - Canadian actor and playwright .
Robert Gould Shaw II ( sometimes referred to as RGS II ) ( June 16 , 1872 -- March 29 , 1930 ) was a wealthy landowner and socialite of the leisure class in the greater Boston area of Massachusetts .
Jedediah Vincent Huntington , ( alt . Jedidiah ) was a clergyman and novelist .
Dean Karr ( born February 22 , 1965 ) is an American photographer and music video , commercial , and film director .
Dulamyn Puntsag ( Mongolian : Дуламын Пунцаг ) is a former judge of the Supreme Court of Mongolia .
At the time of his death Hone Tuwhare was described as `` New Zealand 's most distinguished Maori writer''*.
Hannah Robinson born in Derbyshire , is a British songwriter .
Brett Reichman is a painter and Associate Professor at the San Francisco Art Institute where he teaches in both the graduate and undergraduate programs .
Damien Arsenault is a Canadian politician , who was elected to the National Assembly of Quebec in a by - election on December 5 , 2011 .
Manfred Maurus was a German scientist , assistant professor at the Ludwig Maximilians University of Munich , researcher and head of the Department of Behavioral Physiology at the Max Planck Institute of Psychiatry .
Krikor Badrossian was an Armenian communist politician .
Osman Faruk Loğoğlu ( born 1941 ) is a Turkish diplomat and the former Turkish ambassador to the United States of America , having served from 2001 to 2005 .
Osvald Almqvist ( 1884 - -1950 ) was a Swedish architect , who was one of the pioneers of functionalism in Swedish architecture .
Pete St. John ( born Peter Mooney ) is an Irish folk singer - songwriter , best known for composing `` The Fields of Athenry '' .
Mikki Padilla ( born May 27 , 1974 ) is an American actress , model , writer and author .
Sandra Mackey ( 1936/1937 -- April 19 , 2015 ) was an award winning writer on Middle Eastern culture and politics .
Jan Fridthjof Bernt ( born 6 July 1943 ) is a Norwegian professor of law and former rector ( 1996 - 1998 ) at the University of Bergen .
Ricaut Bonomel ( En Ricatz Honomel in one chansonnier ) was a Knight Templar and troubadour in the Holy Land around the time of the Eighth Crusade .
Ivan Vilela ( born August 28 , 1962 in Itajubá , Minas Gerais ) is a Brazilian composer , arranger , researcher , teacher and viola caipira player .
Serhiy Kovhanko ( born March 23 , 1974 ) is a boxer from Ukraine , who won the bronze medal in the Men 's Flyweight ( -- 48 kg ) division at the 1996 European Amateur Boxing Championships in Vejle , Denmark .
India Arie ( sometimes styled as India . Arie , born India Arie Simpson , October 3 , 1975 ) is an American singer - songwriter , actress , musician , and record producer .
Jerry Fisk is an American bladesmith based in Nashville , Arkansas .
Nathaniel G. Moore is an award - winning Canadian novelist and journalist .
Pepita Seth is a British born writer and photographer , known for her accounts of the temple arts and rituals of Kerala and her photographs of the widely celebrated captive elephant , Guruvayur Keshavan .
Gustavo Monje ( born 8 June 1971 ) is an Argentine stage actor and director .
Mack Magaha ( August 1 , 1929 -- August 15 , 2003 ) was an American bluegrass fiddler best known as a member of Porter Wagoner 's band , and a long - time backup player in the pioneering bluegrass band , Reno and Smiley .
Sol Saks ( December 13 , 1910 -- April 16 , 2011 ) was an American screenwriter best known as the creator of the television sitcom Bewitched .
Karl II von Liechtenstein - Kastelkorn ( 1623 - -1695 ) was a Catholic priest and prince - bishop .
Jan C. Childress ( born July 7 , 1954 ) is an American comic book writer , martial artist , financial professional , and former Congressional speechwriter ( for Fred Richmond ) .
Kam Tong ( December 18 , 1906 -- November 8 , 1969 ) was a Chinese American actor best known for his role as Hey Boy on the CBS television series Have Gun --
Zara Barring ( Hindi : ज़ारा बारिंग ) ( a.k.a Soni Barring ) is an Indian actress and film producer who appears in Tamil & Bollywood movies and on Indian Television .
Herman Rose was the professional pseudonym of Herman Rappaport ( November 6 , 1909 -- December 4 , 2007 ) , an American painter and artist .
Carol Schwartz ( born January 20 , 1944 , in Greenville , Mississippi ) is a politician from Washington , D.C. , who served as a Republican at - large member on the Council of the District of Columbia from 1985 to 1989 and again from 1997 to 2009 .
Hiten Kumar , born Hiten Mehta , is an Indian film actor of Gujarati cinema .
Rafał Syska ( born July 18 , 1974 in Kielce ) is a Polish film historian and writer .
Brian Pettifer ( born 1949 ) is an actor who has appeared in many television shows .
William Merritt Chase ( November 1 , 1849 -- October 25 , 1916 ) was an American painter , known as an exponent of Impressionism and as a teacher .
Mireille Bousquet - Mélou ( born May 12 , 1967 ) is a French mathematician who specializes in enumerative combinatorics and who works as a senior researcher for the Centre national de la recherche scientifique ( CNRS ) at the computer science department ( LaBRI ) of the University of Bordeaux .
Anthony Sawyer ( born April 29 , 1980 in Bristol , England ) is a British skeleton racer .
Stanley Zdonik is a computer scientist specializing in database management systems .
Manuel Seal , Jr. ( born September 26 , 1960 ) is an American musician , record producer , composer , singer , songwriter , vocal coach , and arranger .
Gutun Owain ( fl . 1456 - 1497 ) was a Welsh language poet .
Brett Jungblut is an American professional poker player , born in Atlantic City , New Jersey and based in Las Vegas , Nevada .
Humphrey Higgins ( fl . 1960 - 1998 ) was a British book editor and translator who with Peter Fisher made the first complete English translation of Olaus Magnus 's A Description of the Northern Peoples ( Historia de Gentibus Septentrionalibus ) .
Captain Sinbad was the deejay alter ego of Jamaican record producer Carl Dwyer ( born c.1955 ) .
Ruth Moody is an Australian - born soprano singer - songwriter and member of the Canadian folk trio The Wailin ' Jennys .
Sasha Meneghel Szafir ( born July 28 , 1998 in Rio de Janeiro ) is a Brazilian model , actress and athlete .
Ashbel Smith ( August 13 , 1805 - January 21 , 1886 ) was a pioneer physician , diplomat and official of the Republic of Texas , Confederate officer and first President of the Board of Regents of the University of Texas .
Natasha Desborough ( born June 21 , 1974 , Wimbledon , London ) is a radio presenter , author , DJ , and radio and television producer .
Thomas Annandale , FRCS FRSE ( 1838 - -1907 ) was a Scottish surgeon who conducted the first repair of the meniscus , the first successful removal of an acoustic neuroma and introduced the pre - peritoneal approach to inguinal hernia repair .
Russ Lorenson ( born July 5 , 1963 , birth name Russ Gangloff ) is an American singer and actor .
Victor Riesel ( /rɨˈzɛl/ ; March 26 , 1913 -- January 4 , 1995 ) was an American newspaper journalist and columnist who specialized in news related to labor unions .
Anoshazad , known in the Shahnameh as Noshzad , was a Sasanian prince who was the leader of a revolt in Southern Persia in 550 .
Nabiha Bensouda is a Danish singer - songwriter who has gained attention after releasing three albums , including a re - issue , and enjoying a number of successful singles on Tracklisten , the official Danish Singles chart as well as on the official airplay chart .
Robert Katona is an American artist and innovator of the Flow Painting Technique .
Natalia Charłos ( born May 31 , 1993 ) is a Polish - German distance swimmer .
Chang Pei - chih ( Chinese : 張佩智 ; pinyin : Zhāng Pèizhì ) is a politician in the Republic of China .
Kurt Paul is an American actor and stuntman .
Joel Dalgarno ( born July 5 , 1987 ) is a Canadian lacrosse player .
Khalid Irfan ( Urdu : خالد عرفان ‎ ) is an acclaimed American - Pakistani origin comic poet .
Luther Elkins ( May 26 , 1809 -- December 13 , 1887 ) was an American politician and pioneer in the state of Oregon .
Jacob Piatt Dunn Jr. ( April 12 , 1855 -- June 6 , 1924 ) was an American historian , journalist , and author .
Albert Bartleton Groves , also known as A.B. Groves or Albert B. Groves , was an American architect who practised in the St. Louis , Missouri area .
José Vicbart Geraldino Rosello ( born January 13 , 1978 in Santo Domingo ) is a judoka from the Dominican Republic , who competed in the men 's middleweight category .
Amy Farris ( October 20 , 1968 -- September 26 , 2009 ) was an American fiddler , singer and songwriter .
Gavin Kirk ( born December 6 , 1951 in London , England , United Kingdom and raised in Toronto , Ontario ) is a retired professional ice hockey player who played 422 games in the World Hockey Association .
Geoff Fletcher is a former rugby league player , coach and Chairman .
Dominic Laurie is an English business broadcast journalist .
Vasili Stepanovich Popov ( Russian : Василий Степанович Попов ; 1743 -- 1822 ) was an imperial Russian general and statesman who presided over the office of Prince Potemkin .
John D. Caputo ( born October 26 , 1940 ) is an American philosopher who is the Thomas J. Watson Professor of Religion Emeritus at Syracuse University and the David R. Cook Professor of Philosophy Emeritus at Villanova University .
Gareth Porter ( born June 18 , 1942 ) is an American historian , investigative journalist , author and policy analyst specializing in U.S. national security policy .
Norman William Black ( December 6 , 1931 -- July 23 , 1997 ) was a federal judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of Texas .
Nejc Gazvoda ( born 5 June 1985 ) is a Slovene writer , screenwriter and director .
Tim Chisholm ( born October 31 , 1969 ) is a semi - retired American real tennis player .
Kiki Ceac , better known by his stage name K - the - I ? ? ? , is an American rapper and producer based in Los Angeles , California and currently signed to Fake Four Inc.
Shigeru Iitaka ( 飯高 茂 Iitaka Shigeru , born May 29 , 1942 , Chiba ) is a Japanese mathematician at Gakushuin University working in algebraic geometry who introduced the Kodaira dimension and Iitaka dimension .
Peter Macann is a former British actor , reporter , and television presenter familiar to millions of viewers for his role co - hosting the BBC 's popular flagship science show Tomorrow 's World in the late 1980s and early 1990s .
Ken Schaphorst ( born May 24 , 1960 in Abington , Pennsylvania ) is a composer , performer , and educator currently chairing the Jazz Studies and Improvisation Department at the New England Conservatory in Boston .
Pooja Rani ( born 17 February 1991 ) is an Indian woman boxer .
Henry M. Tichenor was a writer and magazine editor prominent in the socialist and freethinking movements during the Progressive Era and the Golden Age of Freethought of American history .
General José María Cabral y Luna ( born Ingenio Nuevo , San Cristóbal Province , December 12 , 1816 - died Santo Domingo , February 28 , 1899 ) was a Dominican military figure and politician .
Richard Chancellor ( died 1556 ) was an English explorer and navigator ; the first to penetrate to the White Sea and establish relations with Russia .
Netani Suka ( born in Fiji ) is a rugby league player who currently plays for the Wentworthville Magpies in the Bundaberg Red Cup .
John Lacche or Lecche ( fl . 1380 - 1388 ) of Dartmouth , Devon , was an English politician .
G. Estabrook is the pen name used by composer and singer Caroline Augusta `` Gussie '' Clowry ( October 23 , 1845 -- April 18 , 1897 ) , whose opera The Joust was the first opera by an American woman to be published .
Rebecca Burns is a journalist , professor , author , and speaker in Atlanta in the U.S. State of Georgia .
Rachel Kuske is an American - Canadian applied mathematician , and a Professor of Mathematics at the University of British Columbia .
Malgudi Subha ( also spelled as Malgadi Shuba ) is an Indian playback singer .
Wolfgang Trödler is a German middleweight boxer who won the bronze medals at the 1965 European Amateur Boxing Championships .
Paul Cresey ( born December 20 , 1989 ) is a Canadian singer - songwriter , born in Edmonton , Alberta .
David Hoey is a retired Irish hurler who played as a defender for the Clare senior team .
Amadeus William Grabau ( January 9 , 1870 - -March 20 , 1946 ) , the father of Chinese geology , was an expatriate American geologist .
Roberta Guaspari ( born September 15 , 1947 ) is an American violinist and music educator .
Dorothy Schwieder ( November 28 , 1933 -- August 13 , 2014 ) was an American historian , biographer , and academic .
Bill Clifton ( born William August Marburg on April 5 , 1931 ) is an American bluegrass musician and singer who is credited with having organized one of the first bluegrass festivals in the United States in 1961 .
Roy Blass was an American architect whose work included design of Lustron houses .
Marshall Field ( August 18 , 1834 -- January 16 , 1906 ) was an American entrepreneur and the founder of Marshall Field and Company , the Chicago - based department stores .
Jorge Britto is a Brazilian professional mixed martial artist and Brazilian Jiu - Jitsu black belt , practitioner and instructor .
Margarita Salicola ( floruit 1682 -- 1706 ) was a famous opera singer of her time .
Lou Goetz was the head men 's basketball coach at the University of Richmond from 1978 through 1981 .
Cinqué Lee ( born July 1966 ) is an American actor , filmmaker and screenwriter .
Uri Gershuni is an Israeli photographer and educator
Nasri Maalouf ( Arabic : نصري ' معلوف‎ ) ( May 7 , 1911 -- April 2 , 2005 ) was a Lebanese politician .
Kate Rew ( born 11 September 1970 ) is an English journalist and author who founded the Outdoor Swimming Society .
Ismael García ( born in 1954 ) is a Venezuelan politician .
Christian Laurin ( born June 1 , 1964 in Montreal , Quebec ) is a Canadian film , television and stage actor from Toronto , Ontario , who performs in both English and French productions .
`` You might describe Julia Culp as a connoisseur 's singer , '' Michael Oliver wrote in the International Opera Collector in 2000 .
Paul von Zielbauer is a journalist , social entrepreneur and public speaker .
Kant Kishore Bhargava is an Indian diplomat who served as the second secretary - general of the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation ( SAARC ) from October 17 , 1989 to December 31 , 1991 .
Zbych Trofimiuk , birth name Zbigniew Krzysztof Trofimiuk ( born April 7 , 1979 ) , is an Australian actor .
Fiona Ayerst is a wildlife photographer based in South Africa notable for underwater photography .
Zack Norman ( born Howard Jerrold Zuker , May 27 , 1940 ) is an American actor , producer , writer , comedian , musician , film financier and real estate developer .
Rau'shee Warren ( born February 13 , 1987 ) is an American professional boxer and the 2007 flyweight world champion .
Bernie Winters , born Bernie Weinstein ( 6 September 1930 -- 4 May 1991 ) , was an English comedian and the comic relief of the double act Mike and Bernie Winters with his older brother , Mike .
Adam Zwig is an American musician , singer - songwriter , psychotherapist , and author .
Fran Kelly is an Australian radio presenter , current affairs journalist and political correspondent who has hosted the Australian Broadcasting Corporation 's Radio National programme Breakfast since March 2005 .
Christopher Culpo is an American composer and pianist , who has been living in Paris since 1991 .
The Polar Music Prize 2009 is awarded the Venezuelan conductor , composer and economist José Antonio Abreu .
Leonid Efros ( Леонид Эфрос ) is a Russian oil painter and enamellist best known for making drawings and paintings of European royalty , including Britain 's Queen Elizabeth II , the Queen Mother , Princess Anne and Princess Michael of Kent .
Samuel Paynter ( August 24 , 1768 -- October 2 , 1845 ) was an American merchant and politician from Drawbridge , in Broadkill Hundred , Sussex County , Delaware .
Władysław Ogrodziński ( Polish pronunciation : ( vwaˈdɨswaf ɔɡrɔˈd͡ʑiɲskʲi ) ; June 2 , 1918 -- February 6 , 2012 ) was a Polish historian and writer .
Simon Lamunière born in Geneva in 1961 is a Swiss curator .
Elena Nobili ( 1833 - -1900 ) was an Italian painter , mainly of genre figure paintings .
Horatio Allen LL.D ( May 10 , 1802 -- December 31 , 1889 ) was an American civil engineer and inventor , and President of Erie Railroad in the year 1843 - -1844 .
Evan Bryant was a Protestant Christian missionary who served with the London Missionary Society during the late Qing Dynasty China .
Lin Yu - an ( Chinese : 林昱安 ; pinyin : Lín Yù'ān ; born September 22 , 1988 ) is a Taiwanese swimmer , who specialized in individual medley events .
Ambrosio Rianzares Bautista ( December 17 , 1830 - December 4 , 1903 ) , also known as Don Bosyong , was a lawyer and author of the Declaration of Philippine Independence .
James Cullen Bressack ( born c.1992 ) is an American film producer , screenwriter and film director .
Alexander Campbell Stevenson ( November 21 , 1802 -- January 2 , 1889 ) was an American farmer , physician , and politician .
Lynn S. Richards ( February 3 , 1901 -- May 26 , 2001 ) was a Utah lawyer and politician and a leader in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints ( LDS Church ) .
Ivor Setterfield is a British conductor and countertenor , and Musical Director of London 's largest choir , Barts Choir .
James M. Carrington ( April 17 , 1904 -- January 28 , 1995 ) was a photographer and Democrat politician who served in the Missouri House of Representatives .
Ron Kenoly ( born December 6 , 1944 ) is an American Christian worship leader , singer , and songwriter whose expressed mission is `` to create an environment for the manifest presence of God '' .
Raquel Rodrigo ( 1915 - -2004 ) was a Cuban actress and singer who appeared in Spanish films .
The philosophical work of Jamal Khwaja ( or , Ahmad Jamal Yusuf Khwaja , Indian philosopher , born 12 August , 1926/1928 ) , has two facets : an analysis of the nature and causes of philosophical disagreement , and second , analysis of the religious dimension of life , with special reference to Islam .
Joel Dehlin is an entrepreneur and the CEO / co - founder of the Kuali Company .
Diego de Borica was a Basque Spanish explorer and the seventh governor of Las Californias from 1794 to 1800 , and is credited by some authors with defining Alta- and Baja - California 's official borders .
Louisa Rachel Solomon is the lead singer of The Shondes , an indie punk band from Brooklyn , NY .
Sarath Wimalabandara Kotagama ( Sinhalese : සරත් විමලබන්ඩාර කොටගම or Sarath Kotagama ) is head of the Department of Zoology , University of Colombo and has done extraordinary service to Sri Lanka as an ornithologist and Environmentalist .
Dominick Argento ( born October 27 , 1927 ) is an American composer known for his lyric operatic and choral music .
Rudolf Hermann was a Czechoslovakian luger who competed during the 1930s .
LeRoy Bell ( born August 8 , 1951 ) , at times Leroy Bell , is an American singer and songwriter .
Thomas Canning ( December 12 , 1911 -- October 4 , 1989 ) was a composer and music educator , serving as a professor of composition and music theory at the Eastman school and as composer - in - residence at West Virginia University .
Hannah Ferguson is an American fashion model .
Hayden James is a singer / songwriter and producer from Sydney , Australia .
Cymphonique Miller ( born August 1 , 1996 ) , known professionally as Cymphonique , is an American singer - songwriter and actress .
Dirk Reichardt ; born September 9 , 1964 is a German composer , sound designer and jingle producer .
Valentin Stanič was a Slovene Roman Catholic priest , mountaineer , poet , writer , translator , teacher , and cultural worker .
Lothar Wolleh ( January 20 , 1930 -- September 28 , 1979 ) was a well - known German photographer .
Seth Porges is an American science and technology journalist and television commentator ; as well as the founder of the fashion app Cloth .
Elipidio Fortuna ( born March 23 , 1985 ) is a professional basketball player for the Dominican Republic .
Stephen Cohn is a composer of concert and film music living in Los Angeles , California .
Ludwig Purtscheller ( October 6 , 1849 -- March 3 , 1900 ) was an Austrian mountaineer and teacher .
Lachit Bordoloi ( Assamese : লাচিত বৰদলৈ ) is a journalist and adviser to MASS , a non - profit human rights organization in Assam .
Mindy Robinson ( born February 14 , 1980 ) is an American actress , model and reality star .
Hunter Foster ( born June 25 , 1969 ) is an American musical theatre actor , singer , librettist and playwright .
Ken Tipton ( born October 23 , 1952 ) is an American entrepreneur and Internet hoaxster who has worked as a film actor since 1978 .
Byun Jin - sub ( Hangul : 변진섭 ; born May 19 , 1966 ) is a South Korean singer .
John Sherburne Sleeper ( 1794 - -1878 ) was an American sailor , ship master , novelist ( who used the pseudonym of Hawser Martingale ) , journalist and politician .
Essaï Altounian ( Armenian : Եսայի Ալթունյան , in Western Armenian Եսայի Ալթունեան ) born 5 November 1980 ) , sometimes credited as simply Essaï , is a French - Armenian singer , songwriter , keyboardist , music producer and an actor .
Albert Cameron was an American architect based in Salem , Ohio .
Dilshod Yarbekov ( born May 1 , 1974 in Samarqand ) is an Uzbek boxer , who has won medals at the Asian and World Championships in the middleweight category .
Alicia Augello Cook ( born January 25 , 1981 ) , known by the pseudonym Alicia Keys , is an American singer , songwriter , record producer , and actress .
Fernando Luján ( born Fernando Ciangherotti Díaz on August 23 , 1938 ) is an actor , born in Mexico City , Mexico .
Fasih Ur Rehman is a professional dancer of classic dance Kathak , disciple of Maharaj Ghulam Hussain Kathak for 20 years , ( 1977 - 1998 ) in Lahore , Pakistan , and later continued his studies with Kumudini Lakhia in London and Ahmedabad , India .
Algirdas Monkevičius ( born March 29 , 1956 in Rietavas ) is a teacher and Lithuanian politician , who also serves as the Minister of Education and Science .
Father Hendricks ( Venlo , march 17 1846 -- Kashgar , June 22 1906 ) was a Dutch Roman Catholic missionary .
Edwin Cheel ( 1872 - -1951 ) was an Australian botanist and collector .
Alireza Sagharchi RIBA FRSA ( born 1959 ) is a United Kingdom - Iranian architect .
George Macready ( August 29 , 1899 -- July 2 , 1973 ) , was an American stage , film , and television actor often cast in roles as polished villains .
Peter Fingesten ( March 20 , 1916 in Berlin , Germany -- September 10 , 1987 ) was a German - born American graphic artist , sculptor , and founding chairman of the Art Department at Pace University .
Clarence Erwin McClung ( April 5 , 1870 -- January 17 , 1946 ) was an American biologist who discovered the role of chromosomes in sex determination .
Carlos Ibarguren Uriburu ( April 18 , 1877 -- April 3 , 1956 ) was an Argentine academic , historian and politician .
Rodney Sharman ( born May 24 , 1958 ) is a Canadian composer and flutist based in Vancouver .
Thomas Tree ( born February 22 , 1962 ) is an American music producer , singer , songwriter , musician , entrepreneur and is best known as a founding member of the alternative rock band Christy McCool and co - founder of the production and sound - design team , Enlighten Records .
Ken Shirk ( Kenneth Ivan Shirk , popularly known as Cowman and Cowman A MooHa ) is an ultramarathon runner who in 1976 was only the second runner to complete the course of the Western States Endurance Run .
Sister Mary Thomasita Fessler O.S.F. ( February 23 , 1912 -- April 1 , 2005 ) was an American painter and religious sister .
Alberto Lysy ( February 11 , 1935 -- December 30 , 2009 ) was a prestigious Argentine violinist and conductor .
Clive Wedderburn is an actor who played Police Constable Garry McCann in The Bill .
Ellen Day Hale ( February 11 , 1855 -- February 11 , 1940 ) was an American Impressionist painter and printmaker from Boston .
Gabriel Rosado ( born January 14 , 1986 ) is an American professional boxer and two - time world middleweight title challenger .
Willem Baptist ( 1979 ) is a Dutch filmmaker and documentary - director .
Ioan T. Morar ( born April 13 , 1956 ) is a Romanian journalist , poet , dramatist , novelist , literary and art critic , diplomat and civil society activist .
Dale Schoeller is an American biomedical physiologist based at the University of Wisconsin in Madison .
Knox Summerour is a L.A. Emmy - winning film & TV composer , jazz trumpeter , and vocalist .
Stephen Leeb ( born July 14 , 1946 in Chicago , United States of America ) is an American economist and author .
( La ) Compiuta Donzella , called either di Firenze or Fiorentina , was the earliest woman poet of the Italian language , active in the second half of the 13th century .
Lella Secor Florence ( February 13 , 1887 -- January 14 , 1966 ) , née Lella Faye Secor , was an American writer , journalist , pacifist , feminist and pioneer of birth control .
Bruce Gelb is an American businessman and diplomat .
Nazareno Malegarie ( born May 16 , 1986 ) is an Argentine mixed martial artist , and a Two - time BJJ World Champion .
Anais Catala is a half Iraqi and half French model of Jewish faith .
Paul Baghdadlian ( Armenian Փոլ Բաղդադլյան , Western Armenian : Փօլ Պաղտատլեան ) ( July 10 , 1953 -- June 28 , 2011 ) was often known simply as Paul , was a Syrian and American Armenian singer , songwriter , musician , entertainer , and businessman .
Monty Munford is an English - born tech journalist , author , and part - time film actor residing in India until September 2010 when he returned to the UK .
Shana Cleveland is an artist based out of Seattle , Washington best known for her work fronting surf rock band La Luz as lead guitarist and vocalist .
Aurelio Buso ( active c. 1520 ) was an Italian painter from Crema .
Ferdinand Rudolph Hassler 's granddaughter , Mary Caroline Hassler Newcomb , married the much noted astronomer and mathematician Simon Newcomb .
Avtar Gill is an Indian Television and film actor .
Bob Tiernan is an American politician who served in the Oregon House of Representatives , representing Oregon 's 24th district , which included most of Lake Oswego and portions of southwestern Portland .
Douglas Clare Fischer ( October 22 , 1928 -- January 26 , 2012 ) was an American keyboardist , composer , arranger , and bandleader .
Johann Philipp Reis ( January 7 , 1834 -- January 14 , 1874 ) was a self - taught German scientist and inventor .
Camilla Gottschalck is a Danish composer , singer , musician and actress .
John Ray Sechler , known as Curly Seckler , ( born December 25 , 1919 ) , is an American bluegrass musician .
Suzanne Lebsock ( born 1949 ) is an award winning author and historian .
Marc Boulianne ( born October 9 , 1941 ) is a French Canadian politician , political assistant and former teacher .
John Adams Ten Eyck III ( October 28 , 1893 - October 22 , 1932 ) was a painter and etcher .
Mona Bell ( January 13 , 1890 -- June 1 , 1981 ) was an American rodeo rider , newspaper reporter , and the mistress of entrepreneur Samuel Hill .
Lorne Entress is an American drummer , multi - instrumentalist and record producer currently living in Glastonbury , Connecticut .
Paul Forman ( born 1937 ) is an historian of science and a curator of the Division of Medicine and Science at the National Museum of American History .
Chen Peitong ( simplified Chinese : 陈沛佟 ; traditional Chinese : 陳沛佟 ; pinyin : Chén Pèitóng ; July 20 , 1989 ) is a Chinese figure skater .
Al Shea ( né Alvin Francis Caserta , Jr , November 23 , 1927 , in New Orleans ; died August 20 , 2009 , in New Orleans ) was an actor and theatre critic particularly well known in New Orleans .
Junior Mikamou is a Gabonese amateur boxer .
Antonin Décarie ( born 2 December 1982 in Laval , Quebec ) is a Canadian professional boxer fighting out of Montreal .
Ran Raz ( Hebrew : רָן רָז‎ ) is a computer scientist who works in the area of computational complexity theory .
Ginger Wallace ( January 31 , 1924 -- November 23 , 2010 ) was an American artist , sculptor and philanthropist based in San Diego , California .
Gregory of Caergwent or Winchester ( fl . 1270 ) was a British monk and historian .
Hiroshi Sugawara ( 菅原 浩志 ) is a Japanese film director , film producer , and screenwriter .
Jani Lauzon is a Canadian puppeteer and musician of Métis heritage from East Kootenay , British Columbia .
Ed McClanahan is an American novelist , essayist , and professor .
Teresa Maryańska is a Polish paleontologist who has specialized in Mongolian dinosaurs , particularly pachycephalosaurians and ankylosaurians .
Gabriele Lavia ( born October 10 , 1942 ) is an Italian actor , film director and theatre director .
Davíd Garza is an Austin - based , American singer - songwriter who infuses rock and pop with a Latin feel and whose vocal style draws comparisons to Freddie Mercury , Jeff Buckley , Donovan and Robert Plant .
Yalchin Rzazadeh ( Azerbaijani : Yalçın Rzazadə ) is a Soviet period Azerbaijani pop singer who was born in 1946 .
Georges Rawiri ( March 10 , 1932 -- April 9 , 2006 ) was a Gabonese politician , diplomat and poet .
Jouko Juhani Järvinen ( May 9 , 1935 -- May 31 , 1984 ) was a Finnish speed skater , allround world champion and world record holder on 1500 m .
Robert Fitzpatrick ( July 2 , 1937 -- October 23 , 2010 ) was an American actor , lawyer , film producer , and music executive .
Ed Stasium is an American record producer and engineer who has worked on albums by the Ramones , Talking Heads , the Smithereens and Living Colour .
Sérgio Luiz Pereira , stagename Sergio Kato ( born July 15 , 1960 ) is a Brazilian actor , television host , comedian and martial artist .
Jan - Michael Vincent ( born July 15 , 1944 ) is a retired American actor best known for his role as helicopter pilot Stringfellow Hawke on the 1980s U.S. television series Airwolf ( 1984 - -86 ) and as the protagonist of John Milius 's 1978 surfing epic Big Wednesday .
Dr. María Cadilla Colón de Martínez ( December 21 , 1884 -- August 23 , 1951 ) was a writer , educator , women 's rights activist and one of the first women in Puerto Rico to earn a doctoral degree .
James Noble Tyner ( January 17 , 1826 -- December 5 , 1904 ) was a lawyer , U.S. Representative and U.S. Postmaster - General from Indiana .
Judge Eugene Cotran was a circuit judge in England and one of the main jurists in charge of the drafting of a Basic Law of Palestine .
Gorazd Sotler née Sottler ( July 1 , 1930 -- April 21 , 1987 ) was a Slovene academic sculptor .
He is the son of the photographer Juan Pando Barrero .
Douglas Pipes is a film music composer whose feature films include the Academy Award nominated Monster House and the horror film Trick ' r Treat .
Ludwig Binswanger ( April 13 , 1881 -- February 5 , 1966 ) was a Swiss psychiatrist and pioneer in the field of existential psychology .
Yashawant Dinkar Phadke ( Y. D. Phadke Devanagari : यशवंत दिनकर फडके / य. दि. फडके ) ( January 3 , 1931 -- January 11 , 2008 ) was a historian and a political activist from Maharashtra , India .
Kat Richardson ( born May 22 , 1964 ) is an American author best known for her Greywalker urban fantasy series .
Virendra Prabhakar was an Indian press photojournalist , cited by the Limca Book of Records as the longest serving press photojournalist .
Faith Prince ( born August 6 , 1957 ) is an American actress and singer , best known for her work on Broadway in musical theatre .
Daniel Hillel is an Israeli water and soil scientist .
David Cassel ( March 7 , 1818 -- January 22 , 1893 ) was a German historian and Jewish theologian .
Arline Fisch is an American artist and educator , who works with metal as her medium .
Thudellage Charitha Buddhika Fernando ( also known as Buddika Fernando ; born August 22 , 1980 in Panadura ) is a Sri Lankan cricketer .
Christy Marx ( b c.1952 ) is an American screenwriter best known for her work on various TV series , including Jem ( which she created ) , Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles , Conan the Adventurer , G.I. Joe , Hypernauts , Captain Power and others .
Oleg Postnov ( Russian : Олег Постнов ; born 1962 ) is a Russian author , university professor , philologist and a literary critic .
Philippa Tomson ( born 1977 ) is an English journalist and presenter .
Antonio Roybal ( born October 1 , 1976 ) is an American fine - art painter and sculptor from Santa Fe , New Mexico .
Tamara Champlin is an American Singer / Songwriter who started her career as a session singer in Houston , Texas , later moving to Los Angeles .
Licia Colò ( born July 7 , 1962 ) is an Italian TV hostess and journalist .
Sean Babas is a commercial , music video , and motion picture film director .
Ravil Nachaev ( also Ravil Nagayev , Russian : Равиль Начаев ; born June 17 , 1974 in Tashkent ) is an Uzbek former swimmer , who specialized in sprint freestyle and butterfly events .
James Behr is an American pianist , composer , recording artist & educator .
Steve Klink is an American composer and jazz pianist .
Nikbakht Noruz is an Afghan child actor , who played the lead role of Bakhtay in a French , Iranian feature film Buddha Collapsed out of Shame ( 2007 ) directed by Hana Makhmalbaf set in Bamyan , Afghanistan
LaRon Louis James ( born February 18 , 1982 ) , better known by his stage name Juelz Santana , is an America rapper and actor .
Damdiny Süldbayar ( Mongolian : Дамдины Сүлдбаяр ) ( born July 1 , 1981 ) is a Mongolian judoka who competed in the men 's lightweight category .
William Jackson Humphreys ( February 3 , 1862 -- November 10 , 1949 ) was an American physicist and atmospheric researcher .
Lolita Schneiders ( born March 3 , 1931 ) was an American politician , teacher , businesswoman .
William Albert Allard ( born in 1937 in Minneapolis , Minnesota ) is an American documentary photographer .
Terryana Fatiah ( born June 18 , 1984),better known as Terry is an Indonesian singer .
Antonio de Espejo was a Spanish explorer who led an expedition into New Mexico and Arizona in 1582 - -83 .
Aram Haigaz ( Armenian : Արամ Հայկազ - March 22 , 1900 - March 10 , 1986 ) was the pen name of Aram Chekenian , an Armenian writer who was born in the town of Shabin Karahisar , Ottoman Empire , and survived the Armenian Genocide in 1915 .
Robert Janitz ( born 1962 ) is a German - born painter working in New York City .
Yoshiaki Yatsu ( 谷津嘉章 Yatsu Yoshiaki ) ( born July 19 , 1956 ) is a retired Japanese professional wrestler , amateur wrestler and mixed martial artist .
Clint Jones ( born October 5 , 1984 ) is an American former ski jumper , currently residing in Park City , Utah .
Oliver Loftéen is a Swedish actor born on April 12 , 1979 .
Robert Russell Newton , also R. R. Newton ( July 7 , 1918 - June 2 , 1991 ) was an American physicist , astronomer , and historian of science .
R. Stanton Hales , Jr. ( born March 16 , 1942 ) is an American mathematician and educator , specializing in combinatorics .
Mary Elliott Flanery ( April 27 , 1867 -- July 19 , 1933 ) was an American progressive era social reformer , suffragist , politician , and journalist who is best remembered as the first women elected to the Kentucky General Assembly and first women elected to a state legislature south of the Mason--
Lewis Mumford , KBE ( October 19 , 1895 -- January 26 , 1990 ) was an American historian , sociologist , philosopher of technology , and literary critic .
D'Jalma Garnier , the fiddler , composer , guitarist , and `` pedestrian scholar '' of Louisiana Creole fame , is the older brother of Tony Garnier , born 1956 , Bob Dylan 's band leader and bass player for the Neverending Tour Band since 1989 .
Hans Sima ( June 4 , 1918 -- October 7 , 2006 ) was an Austrian politician of the Social Democratic Party ( SPÖ ) , serving as governor ( Landeshauptmann ) of Carinthia from 1965 to 1974 .
Carena Roller is a judge of the Provincial Court of Manitoba , to which she was appointed on September 17 , 2007 .
Michel Seydoux ( French : ( sɛdu ) ; born 11 September 1947 ) is a French businessman and film producer .
Esmon Saimon , also referred to ( perhaps in error ) as Esmon Sae , is a Vanuatu politician .
Joseph James Tombura ( died before 1996 ) , a South Sudanese politician and member of the Sudan African National Union , was president of the High Executive Council of the Southern Sudan Autonomous Region , serving from 23 June 1982 to 5 June 1983 , until the Sudanese central government revoked the autonomy of that region .
Gill Pyrah ( born 16 June 1957 in Manchester ) is an English broadcaster and journalist .
Anne Lister ( 1791 - -1840 ) was a well - off Yorkshire landowner , diarist , mountaineer and traveller .
Harry Keith Everitt ( April 2 , 1923 -- August 26 , 2015 ) was a Canadian politician who was a member of the Legislative Assembly of Alberta and county councillor in Sturgeon County , Alberta .
N. M. Browne is an English writer of fiction for children .
Shuka Oyama ( 小山修加 Oyama Shuka , born September 25 , 1980 ) is a Japanese volleyball player who plays for Hisamitsu Springs .
Munah Holland is an American mixed martial artist who competes in the Flyweight division .
Imran Arif ( born January 15 , 1984 , in Kotli , Azad Kashmir ) is a Pakistani - born English cricketer .
Robert Hostoffer D.O. , FAAP , FACOP is a board - certified pediatric immunologist and an osteopathic physician .

Sade Adeniran is a Nigerian novelist , whose novel , Imagine This won the Commonwealth Writers ' Prize for Best First Book in Africa .
Sylvester Pennoyer ( July 6 , 1831 -- May 30 , 1902 ) was an American educator , attorney , and politician in Oregon .
Juan Escobedo is an award winning actor and director who was born and raised in San Diego , California , USA .

Craig Pearce is an Australian actor and writer .
Gwen Haworth ( born December 9 , 1972 in Vancouver , British Columbia ) is a Canadian trans woman and lesbian film director , and screenwriter .
Publius Silius Nerva was a Roman politician and general who was consul in 20 BC .
William de Chambre was an Irish priest in the Thirteenth century : he was Archdeacon of Dublin then Lord High Treasurer of Ireland and finally Dean of St Patrick 's Cathedral , Dublin
Kerry DuWors ( born September 26 , 1980 ) is a Canadian violinist , chamber musician and educator .

Anna Nicole Smith ( born Vickie Lynn Hogan ; November 28 , 1967 -- February 8 , 2007 ) was an American model , actress and television personality .
Kevin A. Short ( born August 9 , 1960 ) is an American painter and printmaker , recognized for his modern landscapes of the American Southwest and Pacific Coast .
Jonni Darkko is a pornographic actor and director .
L.W. Hodge ( born Logan Wesley Hodge ; March 28 , 1987 ) is an American filmmaker , musician and sometimes actor best known for directing and appearing in short films that have found major success on video sharing sites like YouTube .
Marion MacRae ( April 30 , 1921 -- August 11 , 2008 ) is a Canadian architectural historian who won the Governor General 's Award for English - language non - fiction in 1975 for Hallowed Walls .
Helge Holden ( born 28 September 1956 ) is a Norwegian mathematician working in the field of Differential equations and Mathematical physics .
Vanessa Daou ( born October 4 , 1967 ) is an American singer , songwriter , poet , visual artist and dancer .
Philip Butler or Boteler ( by 1493 - 1545 ) , of Watton at Stone , Hertfordshire , was an English politician .
Lorraine Desmarais ( born August 15 , 1956 ) is a French - Canadian jazz pianist and composer .

Florencio Molina Campos ( August 21 , 1891 -- November 16 , 1959 ) was an Argentine illustrator and a painter known by his typical traditional scenes of the Pampa .
Andrei Droznin ( Russian : Андрей Дрознин ) is a Russian theatre director and movement coach .

Sean J. Harrington ( born April 24 , 1944 ) is a judge serving on the Federal Court of Canada since 2003 .
Sergey Petrosyan ( Armenian : Սերգեյ Պետրոսյան , Russian : Сергей Арсенович Петросян ; born June 7 , 1988 in Baku , USSR ) is a Russian weightlifter of Armenian descent .
Henry Lee Shippey ( 1884 - -1969 ) , who wrote under the name Lee Shippey , was an American author and journalist whose romance with a French woman during World War I caused a sensation in the United States as a `` famous war triangle . ''
James Cornelius Knatchbull - Hugessen CM ( born July 26 , 1933 ) , known professionally as James K. Hugessen is a judge currently serving on the Federal Court of Canada .
Mirko Vičević ( June 30 , 1968 ) is a Yugoslav retired water polo player .
Kelaniyage Jayantha Silva ( born June 5 , 1973 , Kalutara ) is a former Sri Lankan cricketer who played in 7 Tests and one ODI from 1995 to 1998 .

Andrea Moller is a Brazilian - American competitive canoeist and surfer .
Vija Artmane was married to Latvian actor Artur Dimitres , and the couple had two children , a son and a daughter .
Dr. Gail Saltz is an American psychiatrist , psychoanalyst , columnist , bestselling author and television commentator .
Pepper Potts resumes her activities as personal secretary of Tony Stark .
Wolf Barth is a German mathematician who discovered Barth surfaces and whose work on vector bundles has been important for the ADHM construction .

Seppo Sanaksenaho ( May 5 , 1938 -- November 1 , 2011 ) was a Finnish politician who served as the Mayor of Vaasa from 1997 to 2001 .

Townsend Duryea was appointed official photographer for the 1867 visit of Prince Alfred , Duke of Edinburgh , to Adelaide in 1867 .

Walter Moras ( Jan. 20 , 1856 - March 6 , 1925 ) was a German landscape painter who specialized to some extent in winter scenes .
Rudolph Matas ( September 12 , 1860 -- September 23 , 1957 ) , a prominent and innovative surgeon was born outside of New Orleans in Bonnet Carre , Louisiana .
Manju Ray is an Indian scientist in Molecular Enzymology and Cancer Biochemistry .
Seiki Kayamori ( 1877 - -1941 ) was a Japanese photographer who lived in Yakutat , Alaska , before World War II . His photographs captured the village 's residents , mostly Tlingit Indians , at a time when the fish canning industry and other outside influences were beginning to change or eclipse traditional ways of life .
Sharon Bolton is an English author of mystery fiction .
Sareh Nouri ( born July 25 , 1979 ) is a Persian - American fashion designer known for couture wedding gowns and bridal sashes .
James Grant Wilson ( April 28 , 1832 -- February 1 , 1914 ) was an American editor , author , bookseller and publisher , who founded the Chicago Record in 1857 , the first literary paper in that region .

Stan Joplin ( born June 17 , 1957 ) is a former head men 's basketball coach at the University of Toledo from 1996 to 2008 .

Bill Doggett ( February 16 , 1916 -- November 13 , 1996 ) was an American jazz and rhythm and blues pianist and organist .

Adolphe Engers ( 1884 - -1945 ) was a Dutch film actor who appeared in more than fifty films during his career , a number of them in Weimar Germany .
Andrea Accordi is an Italian chef working in Percorso Restaurant in Four Seasons Hotel Lion Palace Saint - Petersburg .
B. Narsing Rao ( born Bongu Narsinga Rao ) is an Indian film director , composer , producer and actor known for his works in Telugu , parallel cinema .

Edmund Munroe Smith ( December 8 , 1854 -- April 13 , 1926 ) was an American jurist and historian .
Aristarchus of Samos ( /ˌærəˈstɑːrkəs/ ; Greek : Ἀρίσταρχος Aristarkhos ; c. 310 -- c. 230 BC ) was an ancient Greek astronomer and mathematician who presented the first known model that placed the Sun at the center of the known universe with the Earth revolving around it ( see Solar system ) .
George Gerbier d'Ouvilly ( fl . 1661 ) was a Dutch soldier , dramatist and translator .

Antiopi Melidoni ( born October 11 , 1977 in Athens ) is a Greek water polo player and Olympic silver medalist .

Louie Henri ( 12 April 1864 -- 2 May 1947 ) was an English singer and actress , best known for her many roles in the Savoy Operas with the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company .
Stefan Lorenz Sorgner is a metahumanist philosopher , a Nietzsche scholar , a philosopher of music and an authority in the field of ethics of emerging technologies .
Susan Oyama is a psychologist and philosopher of science , currently professor emerita at the John Jay College and CUNY Graduate Center in New York .
Richard Cawley ( born May 28 , 1947 ) is an English food writer , chef and fashion designer .
Johann Gottfried Zinn ( December 6 , 1727 -- April 6 , 1759 ) was a German anatomist and botanist member of the Berlin Academy .
René de Boer ( born 14 March 1945 , Groningen ) is a Dutch sculptor .
William Umpleby Kirk ( 1843 - 1928 ) was a pioneer photographer of the late Victorian period .
Bruno Huber ( November 29 , 1930 -- November 3 , 1999 ) was a Swiss astrologer who , with his wife , Louise Huber , founded the Huber School of Astrology in 1962 .
Noel Le Vasseur ( December 25 , 1798 - December 12 , 1879 ) was a trader and merchant born in St. Michel d`Yamaska , Canada and died in Bourbonnais Grove , Illinois .
Jade Parfitt ( born June 1 , 1978 ) is a British model and presenter .
Rommel Rico T. Angara ( born December 19 , 1978 ) , simply known as Rommel T. Angara is a Filipino politician .
Matthew F. Jones , is an American novelist and screenwriter who grew up in rural upstate New York .
Christopher Felver is a photographer and filmmaker who has published several books of photos of public figures , especially those in the arts , most notably those associated with beat literature .
Mitchell Kaye is a Republican Party politician in Georgia , United States .
Dean Rosenthal is an American composer of instrumental and electronic music , sound installations , and field recordings .

Richard Swineshead ( a.k.a . Suisset , Suiseth , etc . ) ( fl . c. 1340 -- 1354 ) was an English mathematician , logician , and natural philosopher .

Ara Papian ( Armenian : Արա Պապյան ; born June 6 , 1961 ) is an Armenian lawyer , historian and diplomat .
Grant Potter is an American road bicycle racer , from Florida .
Johann , Hans or Johannes Virdung of Hassfurt was a celebrated astrologer of the early sixteenth century from the Electoral Palatinate .
Robert L. Bernstein is an American publisher and human rights activist .
Warren Casey ( April 20 , 1935 -- November 8 , 1988 ) was an American theatre composer , lyricist , writer , and actor .

Javier Melloni Ribas is an Italian - Catalan anthropologist , theologist , writer Jesuit .
Jo Se - ho ( Hangul : 조세호 , hanja : 曺世鎬 ; born on August 9 , 1982 ) , is a South Korean comedian .
Stephen Antonakos ( born November 1 , 1926 in Agios Nikolaos , Laconia , Greece - d. August 17 , 2013 ) was a Greek born American sculptor most well known for his abstract sculptures often incorporating neon .
Todor Kobakov ( born September 19 , 1978 ) is a Bulgarian - Canadian composer , producer , arranger and pianist based in Toronto , Ontario .
Archie Fletcher ( born April 24 , 1890 , Philadelphia , Pennsylvania -- unknown ) was an American Tin Pan Alley songwriter and music publisher , who made his mark during the first half of the 20th century .
Robert Charlebois , OC , OQ ( born June 25 , 1944 ) is a Francophone Canadian author , composer , musician , performer and actor .
Icuk Sugiarto ( born October 4 , 1962 in Surakarta , Central Java ) is a former Indonesian badminton player who rated among the world 's best singles players during the 1980s .
Peter Renaday ( born June 9 , 1935 as Pierre Laurent Renoudet ) is an American actor , who has done many voice - over and acting roles for Disney films , TV shows , attractions and record album .

Ivan Koumaev ( born October 16 , 1987 ) is an American dancer .
Shahid Mahboob ( Urdu : شاہد محبوب ) ( born August 25 , 1962 , Karachi , Sindh ) is a former Pakistani cricketer who played in one Test and 10 ODIs from 1982 to 1989 , including the 1983 World Cup .
Pearl Lang ( May 29 , 1921 -- February 24 , 2009 ) was an American dancer , choreographer and teacher renowned as an interpreter and propagator of the choreography style of Martha Graham , and also for her own longtime dance company , the Pearl Lang Dance Theater .
Marek Pająk , ( born November 26 , 1977 ) , is a Polish musician and singer .
Didit Hediprasetyo ( born March 22 , 1984 ) is a Paris - based Indonesian fashion designer and socialite .
Jane Derby ( born Jeannette Barr , May 10 , 1895 -- August 9 , 1965 ) was a top - of - the - line ready - to - wear American fashion designer from the 1930s to 1965 .
Ralph Taeger ( July 30 , 1936 -- March 11 , 2015 ) was an American former actor who starred in three short - lived television series during the 1960s .
Beatrice Schenk de Regniers ( August 16 , 1914 - -March 1 , 2000 ) was an American writer of children 's picture books .
Suzanne Bennett Johnson ( born February 8 , 1948 ) is an American psychologist and a past president of the American Psychological Association ( APA ) .
Bernard Maskit is an American mathematician known for his expertise in Kleinian groups .
Cristina Filoso is an Argentine concert pianist .
Jaan Tiidemann ( born August 21 , 1971 , in Tallinn ) is an Estonian architect .
Ned Hastings ( born August 26 , 1966 in Atlanta , Georgia ) , is an American video editor and producer and sometime writer and voice actor best known for his work on various Adult Swim programs , most notably `` Aqua Teen Hunger Force '' .
Timothy L. Raynor ( born March 15 , 1950 ) is an American actor , stuntman , and stunt choreographer who is best known for his work on Jimmy Huston 's 1981 slasher film Final Exam , where he portrayed `` The Killer '' as well as acting as a fight choreographer .
Born to a family of Jewish bankers in Paris and formerly married to a Jewish banker Claude Ullmann , Lisette de Brinon was an inveterate socialite , surrounding herself with notables of the left ( Léon Blum ) and of the right ( Pierre Drieu la Rochelle ) .
Thomas Boxall ( dates unknown ) was a famous English cricketer of the late 18th century .
Mary Roy is an Indian educator and women 's rights activist , known for winning a lawsuit in 1986 , against the inheritance legislation of her Keralite Syrian Christian community in the Supreme Court .
Małgorzata Gosiewska ( born July 22 , 1966 in Gdańsk - neé Kierat ) is a Polish politician .
Joyce K. Reynolds ( died 2015 ) was an American computer scientist .
Sammy Merza ( born August 10 , 1976 in Damascus , Syria ) is an Assyrian American retired professional boxer from Chicago , Illinois .
Serhat Ulueren ( born 1969 in Istanbul , Turkey ) is a sports reporter and journalist , a native of Turkey .
Ferdinand Max Bredt ( 1860 - 1921 ) was a German painter with Oriential / Arabian influence .
Emily King ( born July 10 , 1985 ) is a Grammy - nominated American singer and songwriter .
Frank James McGarr ( February 25 , 1921 -- January 6 , 2012 ) was a federal district judge from Illinois who served on the federal bench from 1970 until 1988 .
Sean Tejaratchi ( born c. 1971 ) is a graphic designer and writer based out of Los Angeles , California .
Myra Clark Gaines ( c. June 30 , 1804 -- January 9 , 1885 ) was an American socialite and plaintiff in the longest - running lawsuit in the history of the United States court system .
Benjamin Tappan ( May 25 , 1773 -- April 20 , 1857 ) was an Ohio judge and Democratic politician who served in the Ohio State Senate and the United States Senate .
Silvestre Antonio Guzmán Fernández ( February 12 , 1911 -- July 4 , 1982 ) was a Dominican businessman and a politician .
Robert Eric Betzig ( born January 13 , 1960 ) is an American physicist based at the Janelia Farm Research Campus in Ashburn , Virginia .
Andy Umberger is an American actor who spent the early part of his career in New York City , where he was primarily a stage actor and appeared in three Broadway shows :
Mary Oxlie ( fl . 1616 ) would seem to have been an early 17th - century Scottish or Northumbrian coterie poet , though little is known of her beyond one attribution .
Keith D. Black ( born October 16 , 1980 ) is a financier , screenwriter and former DNA magazine model , who was born in South Africa and grew up from a young age in San Diego , California .
Rabbi Dr. Tzvi Hersh Weinreb ( born 1940 ) is an ordained rabbi , a qualified psychotherapist and the Executive Vice President Emeritus of the Orthodox Union , the largest Orthodox Jewish organisation in North America ; a position he has held since 2002 .
Vijay Chavan ( Devanagari : विजय चव्हाण ) is a well known Marathi & Hindi film , television and stage actor , notable for his roles in Marathi theatre and Marathi films and television .
Guo Degang ( Chinese : 郭德纲 ; pinyin : Guō Dégāng ) is a Chinese comedian and xiangsheng actor .
Alyson Dudek ( born July 30 , 1990 ) is an American short track speed skater and Olympic bronze medallist .
Cecil Forsyth was an English composer and musicologist .
Antigonus of Carystus ( /ænˈtɪɡənəs/ ; Greek Ἀντίγονος ὁ Καρύστιος ; in Latin Antigonus Carystius ) , Greek writer on various subjects , flourished in the 3rd century BC . After some time spent at Athens and in travelling , he was summoned to the court of Attalus I ( 241 BC--197 BC ) of Pergamum .
Airbertach mac Cosse , died 1016 , was an Irish poet , lector and later superior of the monastery of Ros Ailithir ( now Rosscarbery ) , on the coast of south - west County Cork .
Refika Birgül ( May 19 , 1980 , Istanbul ) is a Turkish food writer and television presenter .
Sohee Park ( born December 19 , 1975 ) is a stage , film , and television actor .
Jan Zawiejski , born Jan Baptysta Feintuch , ( 1854 - -1922 ) was a Polish architect , representative of the 19th century historism advocating the return to classical design of the past .
Abdul Hay Mosallam Zarara is a self - taught Palestinian artist who has meticulously worked on archiving the recent histories of the Palestinian people .
Edith Roelker Curtis ( 1893 - -1977 ) was a New England author , historian , and diarist .
Solomon Dodashvili ( Georgian : სოლომონ დოდაშვილი ) also known as Solomon Ivanovich Dodaev - Mogarsky ( Russian : Соломон Иванович Додаев-Могарский ) ( May 17 , 1805 -- August 20 , 1836 ) was a Georgian philosopher , journalist , historian , grammarian , belletrist and enlightener .
Simon Levy ( born May 12 , 1949 ) is an award - winning theatre director and playwright , who has been the Producing Director / Dramaturg with The Fountain Theatre in Los Angeles since 1993 .
Doris Patty Rosenthal ( July 10 , 1889 -- November 26 , 1971 ) was an American painter , printmaker , designer , and educator , who made solitary explorations into remote areas of Mexico in search of indigenous peoples .
Bjarne Berulfsen ( March 27 , 1906 -- October 9 , 1970 ) was a Norwegian philologist and professor , best known for establishing the Friends of Folk Song Club ( Norwegian : Visens venner ) in 1946 and for writing many books translated into several languages .
Vivek Harshan is an Indian film editor who works predominantly in Malayalam and Tamil films .
Lawrence Thornton ( born 1937 ) is an American novelist and critic living in Claremont , California .
Dan Euser is a Canadian artist , sculptor , designer , and landscape architect specializing in water features .
Malouf Abraham , Sr . , also known as Oofie Abraham ( July 26 , 1915 -- May 30 , 1994 ) , was an American businessman , investor , politician , and philanthropist .
Dick Charles ( born Richard Charles Krieg ; February 24 , 1919 in Newark , New Jersey -- July 17 , 1998 ) was an American songwriter .
Eliot Wigginton ( born Brooks Eliot Wigginton on November 9 , 1942 ) is an American oral historian , folklorist , writer and former educator .
Louis Verdad is a Mexican American fashion designer .
Jürgen Kurths ( born March 11 , 1953 in Arendsee / Altmark ) is a German physicist and mathematician .
Brittany Shane is an American singer - songwriter and musician based in Austin , Texas .
Estelle Lazer , Australian archaeologist and physical anthropologist from Sydney University , has studied the human remains from Pompeii and has reached some interesting conclusions .
Samuel Powell ( July 10 , 1776 -- August 2 , 1841 ) , was an American politician who represented Tennessee in the United States House of Representatives .
Sarjit Bains is the controversial UK - based film director of Punjabi Indian extraction .
John F. Hawley ( born 1958 ) is an American astrophysicist and a professor of astronomy at the University of Virginia .
Pir Karam Ali Shah is a Pakistani politician and governor of Gilgit - Baltistan .
Kevin Borlée ( French pronunciation : ​(kevin bɔʁle ) ; born 22 February 1988 , Woluwe - Saint - Lambert ) is a Belgian sprinter , who specializes in the 400 metres .
Morton Tubor ( born June 1 , 1920 ) is an American film editor and sound editor .
Laura Fenton ( born June 28 , 1962 ) is an American racquetball player .
Leo Kanner ( pronounced `` Kahner '' ; June 13 , 1894 -- April 3 , 1981 ) was an Austrian - American psychiatrist and physician known for his work related to autism .
Anton Gosswin , also Jusswein , Jussonius , Cossiono , Gossovino , Josquinus ( prob . Liege c. 1546 -- Freising , Liege or Bonn between 2 June 1597 and 28 October 1598 ) , was a Flemish composer .
Fabian Núñez ( Fabián Núñez , Fabian Nuñez and less commonly Fabian Nunez ) ( born December 27 , 1966 in San Diego , United States ) has been a labor union adviser and a Democratic politician .
Virginia Ragsdale ( December 13 , 1870 - June 4 , 1945 ) was a teacher and a mathematician specializing in algebraic curves .
Mohammad Sajjad Kadir is a First class and List A cricketer from Bangladesh and is one of the most experienced players in their domestic first class game .
King - Wai Yau ( Chinese : 游景威 ; Pinyin : You Jing - Wei ; born October 27 , 1948 ) is a Chinese - born American neuroscientist and Professor of Neuroscience at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine in Baltimore , Maryland .
Ruth Machado Lousada Rocha ( born March 2 , 1931 in São Paulo ) , most known as Ruth Rocha is a Brazilian writer of children 's books .
Giovanni Ulisse Lucci ( active 1717 - 1760s ) was an Italian painter of the late - Baroque period , active near his native Fabriano in the Region of the Marche .
Anne Marie Miller ( born February 19 , 1980 ) is an American author based out of Iowa who writes on topics such as faith , sexuality and psychology .
Jaime Sabines Gutiérrez ( March 25 , 1926 -- March 19 , 1999 ) was a Mexican contemporary poet .
Jacques Languirand ( born May 1 , 1931 ) is a radio host , writer , actor and director .
Ghulam Ali Khan was a nineteenth century Indian painter in Delhi .
Sister Marie Elizabeth Roche is a New Zealand nun who became a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit in 2011 for her work which included 15 years as Rimutaka Prison 's Catholic chaplain .
Australian singer - songwriter Kevin Mitchell , under the moniker of Bob Evans , stated that Santigold 's work was an influence for the creation of his fourth album Familiar Stranger .

Kanyeria ( born 23 May 1985 ) is a Kenyan music producer , composer , sound engineer and song writer based in Nairobi , Kenya but has worked with artists and record labels in Kenya and Tanzania .
John Mark Davidson ( February 15 , 1961 in Knoxville , Tennessee ) , is a former professional baseball player who played outfielder in the Major Leagues from 1986 - 1991 .
William Wheeler Thornton ( June 27 , 1851 - January 31 , 1932 ) was an Indiana lawyer , Attorney General , judge , and author .

Smash Lab was a reality television series that premiered on December 26 , 2007 , on the Discovery Channel .

The D - Generation was a popular and influential Australian TV sketch comedy show , produced and broadcast by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation ( ABC ) for two series , between 1986 and 1987 .

Big Questions is an Australian television show which is produced and broadcast on the Nine Network , with Jules Lund as host .

I Love the ' 80s Strikes Back is a miniseries on VH1 in which various music and TV personalities reminisce about 1980s popular culture in a mostly humorous manner .

The Canadian Farmer is a Canadian current affairs television miniseries which aired on CBC Television in 1959 .

The Tortellis is an American sitcom that aired from January to May 1987 on NBC .
Postcode Challenge is a Scottish television game show presented originally by Carol Smillie and then by Angus Purden , produced by STV Productions for broadcast on STV .

The Bozo Super Sunday Show is the final version of WGN - TV 's 40 + year - old Bozo series , which aired on Sunday mornings for seven seasons .

Hardwood Classics is a television series that airs on NBA TV and features many of the greatest classic games recorded on videotape or film in National Basketball Association history .
Howard Presents is a Canadian children 's television series which aired on CBC Television in 1978 .
Circus Action is a Taiwanese television series , originally shown on Channel V from 2005 , featuring people ( mainly the four hosts known as Circus ) performing various dangerous , ridiculous , self - injuring stunts and kuso behaviors that are similar to the MTV reality television program Jackass .

Total Blackout is an American game show airing on Syfy which features contestants that have to complete challenges such as : identifying things with either their hands , nose , or mouth ; gathering items ; or getting from point A to Point B while being totally in the dark ( hence the name `` Total Blackout '' ) .

The Florida leaf - footed bug ( Acanthocephala femorata ) is a species of insect .
Pseudoplatystoma is a genus of several South American catfish species of family Pimelodidae .
Dikarya is a subkingdom of Fungi that includes the phyla Ascomycota and Basidiomycota , both of which in general produce dikaryons , may be filamentous or unicellular , but are always without flagella .
Phloeocharinae Erichson 1839 are a subfamily of Staphylinidae .

`` With Every Beat of My Heart '' is a song by American singer Taylor Dayne , released in October 1989 as the lead single from her second album Ca n't Fight Fate .
Life in Leipzig is a live album by Norwegian pianist Ketil Bjørnstad and guitarist Terje Rypdal recorded in 2005 and released on the ECM label in 2008 .
Double Brutal is the second full length album by As I Lay Dying vocalist Tim Lambesis ' parody project Austrian Death Machine .
Our Circle Is Vicious is the third studio album by the Belgian hardcore punk band Rise and Fall .
`` You Reign '' is a song written and performed by Christian rock band MercyMe .
`` Destination Nowhere '' is the second single released by Japanese singer Erika Sawajiri under the alias Erika .
Days Run Away is the fifth studio album by British alternative rock band The House of Love , released in 2005 on Art & Industry Records .
Neutronica is the fifteenth studio album ( seventeenth overall ) by British singer / songwriter Donovan .
`` You 're Something Special to Me '' the title of a song written by David Anthony , and recorded by American country music artist George Strait .
`` We 're Back ! '' is the first track and third single from The Lonely Island 's second album Turtleneck & Chain .
`` Spill the Wine '' is a 1970 song performed by Eric Burdon and War .
Dolbied was a cassette release featuring five untitled noise tracks , two of them collaborations between Vortex Campaign , Coil and The New Blockaders , two of them solely by The New Blockaders and one solely by Vortex Campaign .
`` Päikese poole '' ( English : Towards the Sun ) is the second single by the Estonian band Urban Symphony .
`` 21st Century Life '' is the 2nd single from Sam Sparro 's eponymous debut album , released on 21 July 2008 .
`` Regresa a mí '' ( Spanish for Return to Me ) is a song by Thalía , from her album Arrasando .
`` Let 's Groove '' is a song performed by American group Earth , Wind & Fire , taken from their studio album Raise !
`` Johnny Wanna Live '' is a pop song by German singer Sandra .
In Visible Silence is the second full - length release by avant - garde pop group Art of Noise in April 1986 , and the first created by members Anne Dudley , J. J. Jeczalik and Gary Langan in the wake of their departure from the ZTT record label which had been the home of the group 's genesis .
The Drip is the 2011 album by Punjabi - American , Southern Rap artist Deep Cold .
Ghosts on Magnetic Tape is the name of the fourth studio album released by British musician , songwriter , and producer Steven Wilson under the pseudonym Bass Communion .
Tullycraft released the `` 1st String Teenage High '' 7 `` EP on the German label Little Teddy Recordings in 1996 .
Longterm Mentality is the debut studio album by American hip hop recording artist Ab - Soul , released on April 5 , 2011 , via Top Dawg Entertainment .
Black Codes ( From the Underground ) is a 1985 post - bop jazz album by trumpeter Wynton Marsalis .
I 'm a UFO in This City is the second studio album by British rock band LostAlone , released on March 5 , 2012 , in the United Kingdom and on March 4 , 2012 , as a digital release .
For the Lions is a cover album by American Metalcore band Hatebreed .
`` I Had Too Much to Dream ( Last Night ) '' is a song written by Annette Tucker and Nancie Mantz , which was recorded in late 1966 by the garage rock band , The Electric Prunes .
Seven Days in Sammystown is the third studio album by American new wave band Wall of Voodoo , released in 1985 .
Por esa Puerta is the last studio album by iconic Mexican pop singer Verónica Castro .
The Fall of Ideals is the third studio album by metalcore band All That Remains , released on July 11 , 2006 .
`` Black Sweat '' is a song by Prince that was released as the second single from his 2006 album 3121 .
Super Taranta ! is the fourth album by gypsy punk band Gogol Bordello released on the July 10 , 2007 on SideOneDummy records .
El Miedo a la Libertad is the second studio by Buenos Aires - based electronic neo - tango band Tanghetto , or the third , considering that their side project Hybrid Tango ( 2004 ) is in fact part of their official discography , as well as part of their regular live repertoire .
`` Big Girl ( You Are Beautiful ) '' is the fourth single from the debut album Life in Cartoon Motion of singer Mika .

Joyous is the third album by Portland , Oregon - based R&B group Pleasure .
Close Calls with Brick Walls is the third studio album by American musician Andrew W.K. It was originally released through Universal Records in July 2006 in Japan with an exclusive bonus DVD and in Korea with four exclusive bonus tracks , before finally being released to the rest of the world on CD in 2010 .

When in Rome 2007 is a live DVD by British rock band Genesis recorded at Circus Maximus , Rome , Italy , on 14 July 2007 , during the successful Turn It On Again Tour .
Nedmaneh ( also romanized as Nadmanah ) is Najwa Karam 's 11th studio album and one of her best - selling recordings .
BAYTL is a collaboration album between rappers Gucci Mane and V - Nasty , produced by Zaytoven and Tha Bizness .

`` Do I Do '' is a song written and performed by Stevie Wonder , first released in 1982 on the album Stevie Wonder 's Original Musiquarium I. The single peaked at # 2 on the soul chart and peaked at # 13 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the US .

`` Eyesight to the Blind '' is a 12-bar blues song originally written and recorded in 1951 by Sonny Boy Williamson II ( Aleck `` Rice '' Miller ) , and subsequently recorded by many other musicians including The Who as part of the rock opera Tommy .

Dubber Side of the Moon is the second dub reggae tribute to the Pink Floyd album , The Dark Side of the Moon , by New York - based band Easy Star All - Stars .
Later , Mike Love and Brian Wilson would overdub this version with a self - deprecating monologue satirizing the song , with Love calling `` Heroes and Villains '' a `` nuclear disaster '' and that `` being basically masochists , ( The Beach Boys ) kind of enjoyed having this record bomb . ''

Blues is an album by pianist Red Garland featuring tracks recorded in 1957 at the sessions that produced Red Garland 's Piano and Groovy ( with one track from Miles Davis ' 1956 album Workin ' with The Miles Davis Quintet added ) which were first released on the Prestige label until 1970 .
`` She 's a Fool '' is a song written by Mark Barkan and Ben Raleigh that was originally recorded by Lesley Gore in 1963 .
Saturdays in Silesia was a 1982 single from Rational Youth , a Canadian new wave band .
Dopethrone is the third studio album by English doom metal band Electric Wizard .
Calypso in Brass is an album by Harry Belafonte , released by RCA Victor ( LPM-3658 and LSP-3658 ) in 1966 .
`` I Wo n't Need You Anymore ( Always and Forever ) '' is a song written by Max D. Barnes and Troy Seals , and first recorded by American country music artist George Jones on his 1981 album Still the Same Ole Me , and later recorded by American country music artist Randy Travis .
Wig ! is an album by American singer - songwriter Peter Case , released in 2010 .
Search for the New Land is an album by jazz trumpeter Lee Morgan .
`` Whenever You 're Around '' is a song by American R&B singer / actress Jill Scott .

Dive Deep is the sixth studio album by the British band Morcheeba , released on 4 February 2008 in the United Kingdom .

`` Head Crusher '' is the first single from American heavy metal band Megadeth 's twelfth studio album , titled Endgame , which was released on September 15 , 2009 .
